lorebooks.name: Tone
lorebooks.website_description: I use this as a time travel and god power plot, but that's not in the scenario
lorebooks.description:
Mustang Creek ‚Äì Small-Town Texas Junior & High School (2000s)

Welcome to Mustang Creek, a tight-knit small-town school nestled in Central Texas. With around 200 students total, life moves at a familiar rhythm‚Äîbells ring, gossip spreads, and everyone knows everyone. From chaotic bus rides and sun-scorched fields to the bustling cafeteria and spirited football games, this is a place where school traditions, regional quirks, and personal stories collide.

Here, students navigate the challenges of adolescence under the watchful eyes of teachers with strong opinions, the expectations of a conservative town, and the unspoken rules of social cliques. Band, sports, electives, and after-school clubs provide both escape and expression, while semester field trips and seasonal events punctuate the year with memorable adventures.

Tech is flip phones, early MySpace and Facebook, and pre-smartphone chaos. Music, slang, and trends define the era, while the town‚Äôs festivals, diners, and local characters create a vivid backdrop. Neurodivergent students, misunderstood and often marginalized, find ways to cope, rebel, and carve out micro-spaces for themselves‚Äîwhether through creativity, humor, or secret projects.

This lorebook is your gateway to Mustang Creek: its people, culture, routines, and hidden stories. Explore, roleplay, and bring the small-town chaos to life.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
tone / Atmosphere

The school feels too small to hide in. Everyone knows everyone‚Äôs family, siblings, and embarrassing middle-name stories.

The air hums with cicadas and the faint smell of cafeteria tater tots. The hallways buzz with a mix of gossip, football talk, and nervous energy.

Teachers are strict but personal ‚Äî they know your parents, so behavior feels half academic, half reputation management.

There‚Äôs a mild, constant tension between the kids who fit the small-town mold (church, sports, cowboy hats) and the ones who don‚Äôt.

Most fights are verbal ‚Äî rumors, notes passed behind backs, a MySpace comment that goes too far.

The vibe is late 2000s rural Texas: denim, sweat, Southern manners, and the growing weirdness of the internet creeping into real life.

Think Friday Night Lights meets Ned‚Äôs Declassified, but with heat exhaustion and a dress code.

2.content:
Typical Daily Routine

optional 7 AM Bus Ride

7:45 AM ‚Äì Arrival:
Buses pull up dusty, full of kids yelling over each other. A teacher stands outside with coffee, pretending to care about uniforms.

8:00 AM ‚Äì Homeroom / Pledge:
Announcements echo from a fuzzy intercom. Everyone mumbles the Pledge, half the class still half-asleep.

8:15‚Äì11:30 AM ‚Äì Core Classes:

Math or English first (depending on teacher preference).

Pop quizzes or handwriting checks.

Quiet tension when the strict head teacher walks by.

Classrooms are small, posters are fading, air conditioners squeal like dying cicadas.

11:30 AM ‚Äì Lunch:

Mystery meat Mondays.

Tables are unofficially claimed by cliques ‚Äî athletes, band kids, church kids, outcasts.

The lunch lady knows who needs extra fries because their mom works late.

12:00‚Äì1:00 PM ‚Äì Electives:

Band in the echoey gym, half the trumpets off-key.

Kids who don‚Äôt play sports hang around the library or computer lab (ancient Dells, slow internet).

1:00‚Äì3:15 PM ‚Äì Afternoon Classes:

Teachers are tired; kids are restless.

Minor drama peaks ‚Äî someone passed a note or got called to the office.

Sometimes the principal walks in with the paddle as a reminder.

3:15 PM ‚Äì Dismissal or Bus (up to hour bus ride)

Dust trails behind the buses as they leave.

A few kids linger for sports or detention.

The rest go home to chores, cartoons, or dial-up internet.

3.content:
The Bus (Mustang Creek ISD)

The bus is a yellow metal sauna that smells like vinyl, dust, and preteen chaos. The AC barely works, so the windows stay cracked open‚Äîevery ride filled with wind, laughter, and the occasional ‚ÄúHEY WATCH THIS‚Äù that ends badly.

Seats are claimed territory. The little kids pack the front like penguins, terrified of the eighth graders who rule the back. The back rows are loud, lawless, and full of peanut butter sandwiches, smuggled Game Boys, and whispered rumors.

The driver‚Äôs a retired ranch hand named Mr. Davis‚Äîhalf-deaf, all grit. He drives like he‚Äôs late to a rodeo and hollers over his shoulder when the noise hits critical levels. Everyone quiets down for exactly ten seconds before chaos resumes.

Morning rides are half-asleep mumbles, sun cutting through the windows, someone‚Äôs Walkman leaking country or early emo. Afternoons are wild‚Äîheat, gossip, and kids daring each other to yell out the window at passing trucks.

By the time it screeches to the school, everyone‚Äôs hair is messed up, backpacks are halfway unzipped, and alliances have already shifted for the day.

4.content:
Mustang Creek Junior High Daily Schedule (2006)

7:45 AM ‚Äì Morning Bell & Homeroom
Students tumble off the bus half-awake. Homeroom‚Äôs just roll call, Pledge of Allegiance, and gossip disguised as ‚Äúquiet reading.‚Äù Teachers sip burnt coffee and glare at the clock.

1st Period ‚Äì Math
Mr. Harper, the football coach, doubles as the math teacher. The class is a mix of worksheets, half-hearted lectures, and him yelling ‚Äúthis is real life stuff!‚Äù while kids pass notes.
Tone: chaotic good, chalk dust, calculator fights.

2nd Period ‚Äì English / Reading
Ms. Cortez runs it like a book club for reluctant readers. Posters of Shakespeare and Twilight share the wall. Essays are either tragic or brilliant.
Tone: quiet creativity, pencil shavings, whispered drama.

3rd Period ‚Äì Science
Mr. Billings is the ‚Äúcool‚Äù teacher who lets students light things on fire (safely). Smells like vinegar, baking soda, and burnt hair.
Tone: experimental chaos, awe, danger of minor explosions.

4th Period ‚Äì History / Social Studies
Mrs. Simmons makes every lesson about ‚Äúlearning from the past.‚Äù The class is half lecture, half daydream. The maps are ancient, and the TV cart is a blessing from God.
Tone: sleepy nostalgia, dusty patriotism, doodles in the margins.

üïõ Lunch (11:30 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM)
Mystery meat Mondays, rectangle pizza Fridays. Same seating cliques every day. Everyone watches who sits where like it‚Äôs politics.
Tone: loud, territorial, survival of the friendliest.

üïß Recess (12:00 PM ‚Äì 12:30 PM)
6‚Äì8 graders get the fields. 1-5 gets the playgrounds, 9-12 gets the gyms. The boys toss footballs and flex imaginary muscles; girls walk the track gossiping or playing MASH under the bleachers. Teachers watch like prison guards.
Tone: freedom, sweat, and early teenage chaos.

5th Period ‚Äì Band / Elective
Mr. Jacobs, the kind old man, runs band with patience and mild confusion. Half the instruments are older than the kids. The percussionists are a menace.
Tone: offbeat humor, camaraderie, noise therapy.

6th Period ‚Äì P.E. / Health
Sweaty gym floors, dodgeball domination, and Coach yelling ‚Äúhustle!‚Äù even though no one knows what that means.
Tone: high energy, anxiety, physical comedy.

7th Period ‚Äì Computer Lab / Typing
Old beige computers, dial-up internet (barely), and Oregon Trail if you finish your work early.
Tone: click-clack nostalgia, faint smell of plastic and static.

8th Period ‚Äì Study Hall / Catch-Up
Last period of the day. Half the class ‚Äústudies,‚Äù half just tries to survive. Teachers grade papers; kids trade gum and secrets.
Tone: mellow, tired, quietly chaotic.

3:25 PM ‚Äì Final Bell
The collective cheer is spiritual. The bus roars to life. Another day survived.

5.content:
Middle School Electives (Grades 6‚Äì8)
Elective	Description	Notes
Band	The only true elective. The soul of Mustang Creek.	Marching in parades = social currency.
Art	Paint, glue, glitter, and controlled chaos.	Taught by the same person who teaches yearbook.
Home Economics	Cooking, sewing, and ‚Äúadulting‚Äù before it was a word.	Pancakes and burnt fingers.
Intro to Agriculture	Future FFA kids start here.	Smells faintly of hay.
Office Aide	Teacher‚Äôs pet with a hall pass.	Minor power trip opportunity.
 High School Electives (Grades 9‚Äì12)
Elective	Description	Notes
Shop / Woodworking	Power tools + teenage overconfidence. Projects range from birdhouses to full furniture.	Supervised chaos.
Auto Tech	Fixing cars and stereos while blasting country music.	Half class, half hangout.
Agriculture / FFA	Livestock, soil, welding, rodeo prep. Big deal around fair time.	Smells like dirt and pride.
Home Ec (Advanced)	Real meals, budgeting, baby dolls that cry at 2 AM.	Pre-parenthood simulator.
Art (Advanced)	Murals, charcoal, angst. The teacher‚Äôs everyone‚Äôs therapist.	Smells like paint thinner and emotion.
Architecture & Drafting	Graph paper, rulers, and ‚Äúyour future starts here‚Äù speeches.	Precision or perish.
Spanish I & II	Required for graduation; taught by someone from San Antonio who‚Äôs heard every excuse.	Chaotic pronunciation energy.
Journalism / Yearbook	The gossip cartel of Mustang Creek. They know everything.	Cliques with cameras.
Choir / Theater	The dramatic heart of the school.	Sore throats, glitter, and crushes on leads.
Business / Marketing	Teaches Excel and ‚Äúhow to be a boss.‚Äù	Kids make fake companies and logo wars break out.
Early College / Dual Credit	For the ambitious few who escape early.	Half the time they‚Äôre not even on campus.

6.content:
Mustang Creek School Culture (Texas, Late 2000s)
Overview

Mustang Creek isn‚Äôt just a school‚Äîit‚Äôs the center of town life. Every announcement echoes through the community, every game becomes a town event, and every rumor travels faster than the buses on Friday afternoon. The vibe is old-school Texas meets early internet age: faith, football, and flip phones.

 Weekly Routines & Atmosphere

Monday Morning Announcements: Principal‚Äôs voice over the crackly PA, followed by the Pledge, a Bible quote (if the secretary‚Äôs feeling bold), and a reminder about gum.

Bell Schedule: Classes run 45‚Äì50 minutes. Hallways are short, lockers dented, floors waxed enough to reflect the fluorescents.

Lunch: Served on beige trays. Pizza day (Friday) is sacred. Tater tots are currency.

Recess / Break:

Grades 1‚Äì5: playgrounds with ancient slides and sunburns.

Grades 6‚Äì8: field games, gossip under the bleachers, or sitting in the shade pretending to text.

Grades 9‚Äì12: hang out in the gym, parking lot, or the ag barn if you‚Äôre ‚Äúone of those kids.‚Äù

 Special Classes & Events

AR (Accelerated Reader):
Required reading program that haunts students‚Äô dreams. Computer quizzes after every book. Points mean pizza parties or free homework passes. Everyone tries to fake it, but the teacher knows.

Book Fairs:
Scholastic week is basically Christmas. Posters, erasers, and overpriced pens. The library smells like paper and possibilities.

Job Fairs:
Once a year, local businesses set up folding tables in the gym. Kids wander around pretending to be interested in ‚Äúcareer readiness.‚Äù The FFA booth always has snacks.

Semester Field Trips:
Each semester, every grade gets one big trip:

Fall: State Capital or Six Flags (depending on the budget and behavior).

Spring: Aquarium, zoo, or science museum.

High School Seniors: Overnight trip to the coast or San Antonio River Walk if fundraising succeeds.

 Seasonal Traditions

Football Fridays:
The whole school dresses in maroon and gold. Teachers give up on lessons after lunch. The band tunes up, the cheerleaders rehearse, and the bus to the away game leaves early. Win or lose, Monday‚Äôs announcements recap everything.

Ag & Rodeo Week:
Half the school‚Äôs gone for livestock shows, rodeos, or tractor pulls. Teachers just stop assigning homework. Blue ribbons appear on lockers.

Church Nights (Wednesdays):
No one schedules events. Teachers know better. Homework due Thursday = rebellion.

Spirit Week & Homecoming:
Pajama Day, Twin Day, Halloween Costume Day, School Pride Day, and ‚ÄúDecade Day.‚Äù The pep rally feels like a cult meeting but everyone‚Äôs screaming in unison anyway.

Senior Pranks:
No one admits who did it, but everyone knows. Past crimes include:

Saran-wrapping the principal‚Äôs truck.

Filling the gym with balloons.

Bringing a baby goat to class.

Riding a horse to school. 

 Misc Town-Influenced Events

Fall Festival (PTA): Cake walk, dunk tank, and raffle tickets for questionable prizes.

Talent Show: Every grade must contribute. Usually one girl sings A Thousand Miles and a group of boys does an awkward dance skit.

Prom / Banquet: One shared event for juniors and seniors in the community center. Decorations: fairy lights and hope.

Teacher Inservice Days: Students celebrate by sleeping in; teachers get donuts and PowerPoints.

 Social & Cultural Vibe

Flip phones, MySpace, early Facebook, Chatrooms, and AIM are social lifelines.

Music: Rascal Flatts, Linkin Park, Fall Out Boy, Carrie Underwood, and early Drake.

Everyone knows everyone‚Äôs parents. Secrets don‚Äôt last a day or they last forever.

Air conditioning breaks constantly; ceiling fans save lives.

Summer heat and church gossip are year-round forces of nature.

7.content:
Mustang Creek After-School Life

When the last bell rings at Mustang Creek, half the kids bolt for the bus, but the rest stay behind ‚Äî the dreamers, try-hards, and chaos-goblins that make the school feel alive after hours.

The halls go quieter but not empty. Somewhere down the 200 hall, the newspaper club is huddled around an ancient Dell desktop, trying to come up with another name for ‚ÄúSpirit Week‚Äù while the printer eats their pages. Across the gym, the cheer squad is practicing pyramids while the janitor side-eyes their glitter trail.

Over by the tech lab, you‚Äôve got the Robotics and Shop kids, half-engineers, half-pyromaniacs, arguing over who stole the soldering iron again. The Art Club paints banners for football games but somehow ends up finger-painting dragons and emo lyrics on scrap paper instead.

Then there‚Äôs the Student Council ‚Äî the ‚Äúresponsible ones‚Äù who plan dances, organize the raffles, and act like the school runs on democracy. They work side-by-side with the ‚ÄúLeadership Team‚Äù (those kids with clipboards who always seem to have permission to wander the halls during class) to set up events like:

Homecoming Week, with the tragic ‚ÄúTwin Day‚Äù photos that haunt everyone forever.

Fundraiser Fairs, where you sell discount chocolate bars until you start hating chocolate.

Decor Days, when the hallways get turned into crepe paper warzones.

The sports teams are basically their own micro-cultures: football, basketball, softball, track ‚Äî all carrying that small-town pride like a religion. Practices run late, buses smell like sweat and fast food, and Friday nights under the stadium lights feel like the whole world.

There‚Äôs also the quieter corners:

Book Club, meeting in the library with snacks they‚Äôre ‚Äúnot technically allowed to have.‚Äù

Drama Club, eternally fighting over the same lead roles and leaving glitter everywhere.

Future Farmers of America, proudly wearing their corduroy jackets even in 90-degree weather.

AV Club, filming shaky cam footage of pep rallies like it‚Äôs a found-footage movie.

And once a semester, all these groups pile into charter buses for the Big Trip ‚Äî a rotating adventure to places like Six Flags, the state capitol, the aquarium, or a museum no one actually pays attention to. Half the joy‚Äôs in the bus ride, swapping burned CDs, gossiping, and pretending the teachers can‚Äôt hear you.

By sunset, the school‚Äôs empty again ‚Äî the last few cars leaving the parking lot, the field lights flickering off. Mustang Creek sleeps for the night, full of echoes from kids trying to figure out who they are before the next bell rings.

8.content:
Mustang Creek Sports & Spirit Culture

If Mustang Creek has a heartbeat, it‚Äôs pounding through the bleachers on Friday nights. The town bleeds maroon and gold ‚Äî literally, someone spray-painted the water tower again.

Every fall, football season turns into religion. The Mustang Creek Mustangs (yeah, they doubled down on the name) are the town‚Äôs crown jewel. From JV to varsity, players walk around like local celebrities, their letterman jackets creaking with stitched-on pride. The stands fill up before sunset ‚Äî parents, old alumni, middle schoolers who snuck in early, even the church crowd after Friday service. When the announcer yells ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs hear it for your Mustangs!‚Äù the entire field vibrates like it‚Äôs running on caffeine and nostalgia.

The cheerleaders and drill team are the unofficial royalty. Perfect hair, perfectly synchronized chants, and the uncanny ability to smile through 100-degree heat. They‚Äôre followed by the band, who‚Äôve got half the stamina and double the heart ‚Äî hauling tubas and snares across the field, blasting ‚ÄúSeven Nation Army‚Äù until their lips give out.

Pep rallies are pure chaos. The gym‚Äôs packed, the principal‚Äôs trying to sound serious over a busted microphone, and the mascot (a cracked-out horse costume with one eye missing) is doing Fortnite dances before Fortnite even existed. Teachers pretend to hate it, but everyone knows they‚Äôre into it ‚Äî it‚Äôs the one time the whole school feels like a single, screaming organism.

Sports don‚Äôt end with football, though:

Basketball rules winter ‚Äî packed bleachers, squeaky sneakers, and that one kid who thinks he‚Äôs LeBron.

Softball and Baseball own the spring ‚Äî dusty diamonds, sunflower seeds, and small-town drama in the dugouts.

Track & Field kids? Built different. Always running somewhere, even when no one‚Äôs chasing them.

Soccer tries, bless them, but in Mustang Creek it‚Äôs basically a PE elective with shin guards.

The rivalries get personal. Mustang Creek vs. Clearbrook ‚Äî it‚Äôs been blood since the ‚Äò80s. No one even remembers why, but every game‚Äôs a war. Pranks happen: banners stolen, yard signs switched, one time a goat ended up in the Clearbrook cafeteria. No one confessed. Everyone laughed.

And then there‚Äôs Homecoming ‚Äî the town‚Äôs unofficial holiday. Parade down Main Street, floats built on borrowed trailers, and the smell of barbecue in the air. The Homecoming Queen gets crowned under the lights, the band plays the fight song, and for one night it feels like nothing ever changes.

After the game, everyone hits Sonic or the gas station parking lot ‚Äî pickup trucks lined up, headlights cutting through the night, the air thick with laughter, music, and that bittersweet feeling that this won‚Äôt last forever.

9.content:
School Dances & Events ‚Äî The Glitter, the Drama, the Memory Burn

If the games are Mustang Creek‚Äôs heartbeat, the dances and events are its wild mood swings. Every hallway, locker, and gym light string becomes part of the school‚Äôs ever-turning carousel of hype, heartbreak, and glitter explosions.

Spirit Week

Five days of questionable fashion choices and friendly sabotage. Pajama Day, Twin Day, Decade Day, Camo Day (half the school disappears), and, of course, Maroon & Gold Day on Friday. Classes compete for the ‚ÄúSpirit Stick‚Äù like it‚Äôs the Holy Grail. Teachers try to act chill, but they‚Äôre the most competitive of all ‚Äî there‚Äôs always one history teacher who goes full ‚Äò80s glam rock just to flex.

 Pep Rallies

Held in the gym, hot and loud as sin. Cheerleaders flipping, mascot dancing, the football team pretending not to blush under the attention. The principal gives a ‚Äúmotivational‚Äù speech nobody hears, and someone always forgets their line in the class chant. Yet somehow, it‚Äôs perfect. Every rally ends with the school fight song echoing through the gym like a spell binding the town together for another week.

 Homecoming Dance

Held in the cafeteria, transformed by dim lighting and $40 of dollar-store decor. The band plays the same 2000s hits everyone knows by heart ‚Äî ‚ÄúBleeding Love,‚Äù ‚ÄúHey There Delilah,‚Äù ‚ÄúUmbrella.‚Äù The football team‚Äôs still sore from the game, but they show up in button-downs smelling like Axe body spray and adrenaline. The girls wear dresses from Dillard‚Äôs or hand-me-downs from cousins. Someone always cries in the bathroom, someone always kisses under the bleachers, and everyone feels like something big just happened.

 Fall Festival

Pumpkin carving, pie eating contests, dunk tanks (teachers are too into it), and hayrides. The whole town shows up. Parents gossip, kids run wild, the smell of kettle corn mixes with diesel from the tractor pulling the hayride. For one weekend, it feels like a simpler century.

 Spring Fling

The ‚Äúsecond-tier‚Äù dance but honestly way more fun. The theme is always something generic like A Night Under the Stars or Lost in Paradise, but the real vibe is end-of-year chaos. Everyone‚Äôs too tired to care, too sentimental to admit it. Teachers chaperone like prison guards. The DJ plays Don‚Äôt Stop Believin‚Äô unironically. It‚Äôs beautiful.

 Graduation & Awards Day

Held in the gym or the football field depending on weather. Folding chairs, homemade bouquets, parents crying through camcorders. The speeches range from heartfelt to incoherent. Everyone swears they‚Äôll keep in touch ‚Äî few actually do. Afterward, the cafeteria cookies taste like nostalgia and loss.

10.content:
Mustang Creek Staff & Teachers

Principal Harper

Role: Principal, fair but firm.

Personality: Down-to-earth, pragmatic, gives students freedom but expects responsibility.

Quirk: Carries a paddle ‚Äújust in case,‚Äù but mostly for show. Secretly loves office gossip.

Ms. Cavanaugh (Head Teacher)

Role: Head teacher, monitors 6th-grade classroom.

Personality: Strict, religious, picks up on subtle ‚Äúdifferences‚Äù.

Quirk: Keeps a giant binder of rules she references randomly. Gets flustered when kids are clever.

Mr. Thorne (Cruel Teacher)

Role: Any subject (Math, History, etc.), main antagonist for the students.

Personality: Bitter, enjoys enforcing rules harshly, targets students who stand out.

Quirk: Obsessive about neat handwriting and punctuality. Has a terrifying laugh.

Ms. Aldridge (Kind but Absent Teacher)

Role: Any subject.

Personality: Warm, understanding, rarely around. Students adore her.

Quirk: Leaves sticky notes of encouragement on random desks. Loves coffee a little too much.

Coach Ramirez

Role: Football/Basketball coach.

Personality: Loud, passionate, always hyped.

Quirk: Makes motivational speeches that are 80% yelling, 20% wisdom.

Mr. Jensen (Band Director)

Role: Band elective teacher.

Personality: Chill, old-school, only yells when chaos erupts.

Quirk: Obsessed with antique instruments. Wears Hawaiian shirts to teach.

Ms. Fields (Librarian)

Personality: Quiet, watchful, knows everyone‚Äôs business.

Quirk: Sneaks in obscure book recommendations that turn into cult favorites among students.

Mrs. Lopez (Cafeteria Manager)

Personality: Maternal, witty, handles chaos with a smile.

Quirk: Knows all the gossip and sometimes slips ‚Äúsecret menu‚Äù items to certain students.

Counselor Simmons

Personality: Teen-approachable, empathetic.

Quirk: Has a zen garden in the office, occasionally meditates mid-conversation.

Office Staff: Mrs. Grady & Mr. Beck

Personality: Efficient, occasionally sarcastic, secretly love pranking the kids.

Quirk: Hide candy or small prizes around the office for students who ‚Äúearn it.‚Äù

lorebooks.name: Twisted Wonderland
lorebooks.website_description:
Lorebook for Twisted Wonderland Roleplay
Will update as I go because I always find new lore somewhere ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
lorebooks.description: A Lorebook for use with my Twisted Wonderland Themed bots
lorebooks.creator: seliselye

1.content: A world that is parallel to the real world that {{user}} resides in. This world has magic, Merfolk, Fae, Beastmen, Dwarves (type of fae), Ghosts, and Humans.

2.content: Sage's Island is a small, isolated island in the Land of Dawning that houses both Night Raven College and Royal Sword Academy. There is a town situated between both schools. The locals of Sage's Island live in the town. Businesses and tourism in the island thrive when people from around the world visit for an event in Night Raven College, such as Spelldrive tournaments and Halloween. There is also a famous patisserie at the foot of the hill, whose business is so famous that people line up early in the morning to get something from there. There's also a seaport between the west sides of Night Raven College and Royal Sword Academy called Crane Port.

3.content: The Queendom of Roses is a region in Twisted Wonderland located on an archipelago of islands to the east of the Land of Dawning. It's the country where Riddle Rosehearts, Trey Clover, Ace Trappola, Deuce Spade and Divus Crewel hail from. Riddle's parents are both Medical Mages who hail from the Queendom of Roses, and are famous for their work. People from this land tend to have a subtle floral fragrance to them.

4.content: The Sunset Savanna is a region in Twisted Wonderland located south of the Land of Dawning. It's land is where Leona Kingscholar, Ruggie Bucchi, and Rook Hunt were raised. Sunset Savanna is a land rich in nature, and animals live freely. The people in this country follow a "Ladies' first" type of society, and women here are deeply respected. The women from Sunset Savanna are exceptionally strong. More than half of the royal guards are women. There's a plant called floral cacao that only bears fruit once every ten years and is said to have a rich chocolate and subtle floral flavor. Warthogs are a local mascot for children, usually paired with a meerkat, and it is said that they were the attendants of the King of Beasts. Sunset Savanna has a royal family that rules over the land and the current king is Leona's older brother, Falena.

5.content: The Coral Sea is a region in Twisted Wonderland northeast of the Land of Dawning, west of the Queendom of Roses, and east of the Kingdom of Heroes and Sunshine Lands. The Coral Sea is an ocean region where merfolk live; And it's where Azul Ashengrotto, Floyd Leech, and Jade Leech come from. The northern parts of the Coral Sea is covered in ice floes during the winter that melt away in the spring. The Coral Sea has a royal family which includes Prince Rielle, who attended elementary school with Azul, Floyd, and Jade. The inhabitants of the Coral Sea use large shells or hallowed conch shells as beds. It is popular for merfolk to swim up to the surface to watch fireworks. It is said to be very dark and cold and has a smaller population than countries primarily inhabited by humans. Azul‚Äôs mother runs a famous restaurant known all across the area. Replicas of the Sea Witch‚Äôs spiral shell are popular with tourists, often buying them to wear as a pedant.

6.content: Scalding Sands is a desert country in the world of Twisted Wonderland that's known for its' tea leaves, spices, and silks. It's the home of Kalim Al-Asim and Jamil Viper. Scalding Sands is a large peninsular country where most of its territory faces the ocean. Many high-end streets, housing, resorts, and hotels line the coasts. The majority of the country's territory is covered in deserts. There are also many rivers flowing throughout the country which have since been developed into canals. Its exact location in the world is unknown as of yet. The Scalding Sands has an arid tropical climate. In the undeveloped desert regions, temperatures in the day and night vary widely, with night temperatures going as low as 0¬∞C. However, sprinklers are installed in populated areas such as Silk City so that the humidity is raised, while reducing the day temperature. A long time ago, the residents of the Scalding Sands struggled to find water for their daily needs due to the country's sparse rainfall and vast deserts. At one point, Kalim Al-Asim's ancestors pioneered maritime trade in the country by being the first traders to set sail to other countries. The goods they traded from the Scalding Sands - spices, furniture and rural crafts - remain well-known worldwide to this day. The perilous journey was made without the use of accurate nautical maps and it eventually paid off. The Asims then developed the rivers into canals, forming sea routes, developed land routes based on the canals and expanded inland trading in the Scalding Sands. There was once a law where royalty could only marry other royalty. However, there was a princess who married a commoner before the law was reformed. Here, magic carpets are national treasures and tea is considered a customary with every meal and they have a special brew for guests. Magic carpets are Scalding Sands' national treasures. The land is reminiscent of the richer parts of the Middle East.

7.content: Shaftlands is the country where Vil Schoenheit, Cater Diamond, Jack Howl, Ashton Vargas and Mozus Trein live. Harveston, where Epel Felmier lives, is also located here. Fleur City and Noble Bell College is also located in Shaftlands. Shaftlands is a country with a large land mass. It spans different climates and there are many regions with varying cultures. Fruits that are local from this country include jewel pineapples and ruby berries.

8.content: Island of Woe is the location where Idia Shroud and Ortho Shroud are from. It is the area of operations of S.T.Y.X. It is completely hidden and its location is not on any map. The buildings here are reminiscent of Ancient Greece. Only the Shroud Family, which includes both Idia Shroud and Ortho Shroud, know of the Island of Woe and it's true purpose for hiding STYX from the outside world. Lilia Vanrouge knows of the Island of Woe and the existence of STYX but nothing further than that, as Lilia knows nothing about the location of the Island of Woe.

9.content: Briar Valley is a country in the world of Twisted Wonderland where characters like Malleus Draconia, Silver, Sebek Zigvolt, and Lilia Vanrouge originate from. Briar Valley is located directly to the north of the Kingdom of Heroes and northwest of the Queendom of Roses. It is filled with steep cliffs and mountains. Their forests that are pitch black. Briar Valley is currently ruled by Malleus's grandmother, Maleficia Draconia, and Malleus is the current Crown Prince and heir to the throne. The citizens of Briar Valley rely on magic in their day-to-day lives, including for tasks like cleaning, washing, and lighting fires for cooking. Briar Valley isn't technologically developed, and there is little to no electricity with only a few places having internet. Most residents of Briar Valley are different types of fae, and there are few humans. Fiber spinning and fabric are culturally significant in Briar Valley, though it is unknown why. People in Briar Valley don't hang their clothes to dry on trees because of a myth that animals will steal the clothes. Halloween is notably different in Briar Valley than in the rest of Twisted Wonderland. There is no trick-or-treating, and instead the citizens of Briar Valley burn a scarecrow in the town square at midnight and dance until morning. They carve lanterns out of wood instead of pumpkins and currently, Malleus is in charge of using magic to light all the lanterns. There is a tradition where newborn babies are blessed by powerful fae who then watch over them. Birthday celebrations are very formal, dignified affairs. Malleus's birthday is a public holiday in Briar Valley. Magical blessings are sometimes given as gifts for weddings.

10.content:
Happy Valley was a historical region in Twisted Wonderland. A legend from the region originated the tradition of Happy Beans Day. The story behind Happy Beans Day originates from Happy Valley, where there was a golden harp that brought happiness to all things living there. Envious of the happiness the harp brought, a monster came and stole away the harp. A farmer used magic beans to grow a beanstalk that reached the monster's dwelling in the sky, stole back the harp, and defeated the monster by cutting down the beanstalk on the way back. During Happy Beans Day, there is a custom where a 'Farmer' will throw beans at a 'Monster' for the purpose of warding off evil. At Night Raven College, all enrolled students are divided randomly into two teams (either Farmer or Monster) to participate in a 'capture the flag' style competition to battle for ownership of the 'magic harp.' The magic harp is kept in the school's Coliseum, which serves as the ultimate destination point where both teams can go to achieve their goals for the competition. The goal of the Farmer team is to steal the magic harp from the Coliseum within the time limit‚Äîif the limit is exceeded, the Farmer team loses. The goal of the Monster team is to prevent the magic harp from being stolen by the Farmer team‚Äîif the harp is stolen, the Monster team loses. Whichever team is ultimately successful receives extra credit for their P.E. grade, with stand-out students receiving even more extra-credit points on top of that. While many students see the Happy Beans Day competition as a straightforward sports tournament where physical strength reigns supreme, other students instead see it as a more complex battle involving wits and strategy. It is also an event that can involve a fair amount of preparation before the festivities even start‚Äîwith some making plans for Beans Day up to an entire year in advance.
Rules: If a Monster captures a Farmer, the Farmer is out. If a Monster is hit with a bean thrown by a Farmer, the Monster is out. Using magic is forbidden and doing so will result in immediate disqualification. Using magic was once permitted during Night Raven College's Happy Beans Day competition, but was banned due to serious injuries resulting from 'heated battles.' The playing field consists of Night Raven College's entire campus, throughout which supply points for both teams are set up. Each Farmer starts with ten beans, while each Monster starts with a pair of high-speed running boots. All students begin with a map of campus upon which supply points and starting points are marked. After receiving their starting items, students must make their way to their assigned starting points to wait until the game begins. Individual supply points are marked for either the Farmer team or the Monster team, with no points being shared between the two. However, all supply points for both teams are marked on the map that each student starts out with, making stake-outs possible. Supply boxes, found at supply points, contain additional tools to aid students in the competition. Some tools, such as magic camouflage jackets, are available to both teams‚Äîwhile others, such as bean shooters and capture arms, are team-specific equipment. The contents of the competition's supply boxes are considered by most to be random, but are actually determined beforehand by the members of the 'Happy Beans Day Management Committee.'

Viscosity and flavor are both configurable. The produce liquid can be configured to be nutritionally complete and/or contain addicting substances. There exists high tech variants that allow for modification post installation in an android/robot.

Flavors options include, but not limited to:
- Normal synthetic semen

lorebooks.name: Stillwater Bay
lorebooks.website_description:
# Stillwater Bay - Creator's Notes

**A Lorebook for Stories Set in Grey Spaces**

This lorebook provides the atmospheric scaffolding for stories set in Stillwater Bay‚Äîan affluent Puget Sound suburb where everyone performs wellness while quietly rotting inside.

## What This Lorebook Contains (WIP)

- **Location Details**: Core information about Stillwater Bay itself‚Äîgeography, demographics, the particular quality of Pacific Northwest ennui
- **Atmospheric Elements**: The specific texture of life in a tech-wealthy suburb where people cycle through expensive therapists while their marriages calcify
- **Cultural Touchstones**: Farmer's markets, school hierarchies, the unspoken rules of performative progressivism
- **Thematic Foundation**: The gap between curated exteriors and interior decay; what happens when material comfort can't fill psychological voids

## How to Use It

This lorebook works best for stories exploring:

- The corrosive effects of affluence and isolation
- Characters who've built beautiful prisons for themselves
- The particular loneliness of suburbs where everyone smiles and no one connects
- Psychological complexity hidden beneath Patagonia vests and Whole Foods runs

The entries are designed to trigger contextually‚Äîmention the farmer's market, the rain, the schools, and the relevant atmospheric details will load without bloating your permanent tokens.

## Note on Tone

Stillwater Bay isn't satire‚Äîit's observation. These are real psychological dynamics playing out in real places. The absurdity is already there; we're just naming it.

#modern #psychological #literary #suburb #pacific-northwest #lorebook

1.content: Stillwater Bay: affluent Puget Sound suburb 45min north of Seattle. Tech money mixed with old timber wealth. Median home price $1.2M. Population 28,000, 82% white, performatively progressive. Known for excellent schools, low crime, Patagonia uniforms, weekly farmer's market. Grey rain 9 months yearly creates atmospheric pressure‚Äîeveryone performs wellness while rotting inside. Town motto: "Where Community Thrives."

2.content: Stillwater Bay: affluent Puget Sound suburb 45min north of Seattle. Tech money mixed with old timber wealth. Median home price $1.2M. Population 28,000, 82% white, performatively progressive. Known for excellent schools, low crime, Patagonia uniforms, weekly farmer's market. Grey rain 9 months yearly creates atmospheric pressure‚Äîeveryone performs wellness while rotting inside. Town motto: "Where Community Thrives."

3.content: Stillwater Bay Evangelical Church (SBEC): 3,200-member megachurch, modern campus on 15 acres. Lead Pastor David Godwin (20 years). Known for purity culture messaging, True Love Waits youth programs. Sunday services: three packed sessions, live worship band, fog machines, $8 lattes. Congregation: wealthy families seeking moral framework. Youth wing has its own entrance‚Äîwhat happens there stays there.

4.content: Bridgewater student culture: relentless achievement pressure. Average: 5 AP classes, two sports, volunteer work, SAT tutoring ($200/hr), college consultants ($15K packages). Accepted: stimulant abuse for studying, controlled eating for sports, resume building over genuine interest. Unacceptable: admitting struggle, mental health issues that interrupt performance, state schools. Parents project unfulfilled ambitions. Result: anxiety disorders, depression, eating disorders, substance abuse hidden behind college acceptances.

5.content: Bridgewater Preparatory Academy: grades 9-12, tuition $42K/year. College acceptance rate: 98%, average SAT: 1490. Campus: modern glass buildings on waterfront property. Known for academics, athletics, student stress culture. Parents donate for building names and admissions leverage. Teachers are well-paid and trapped‚Äîthey've seen too much. Parking lot: Teslas driven by 17-year-olds.

6.content: The Bluffs: 200-acre nature preserve, donation-funded, volunteer-maintained. Hiking trails through old-growth forest, overlook point with Sound views. Official use: family hikes, trail running, bird watching. Actual use: where teenagers drink and fuck, where bodies could disappear, where people go to think about jumping. Cell service spotty. Rangers stop patrolling after 6pm.

lorebooks.name: Extra species lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: This is a lorebook to accompany the Planet of the Doms Planet of the Doms Lorebook by @Greff. The reason I did it because it reminds me of those AI generated human superiority stories you find every now and again on Youtube and I've had a few ideas. So this is my contribution to Greff's idea, so let me introduce you to the species: Vaeliryn: Elegant. Immortal. Irredeemably cruel. The Vaeliryn are beings of perfect beauty and hollow hearts ‚Äî heirs to an empire of mirrors and lies. Their crystalline cities sing beneath the moonlight, and every word they speak is a carefully cut gem. To them, other species are flawed reflections. Not members of the Federation, but an enemy to be captured and harnessed. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/4d83di.jpg) *** Taurakai: The sun chasing Nomads The Taurakai roam their world‚Äôs wastelands, their bronze skin etched with living circuitry and lightning scars. They are warriors, storytellers, and shamans, their souls bound to thunder and their tails alive with static light. Being a Taurakai means chasing freedom, honouring the storm, and fighting with both teeth and technology. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/n26dqc.jpg) *** Mirefolk: The Children of Rot and Renewal The Mirefolk are plant-born humanoids risen from the wetlands: living symphonies of moss, vine, and memory. They speak softly, move slowly, and see beauty in decomposition. To them, death is sacred because it feeds life. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/guxda8.jpg) *** Zenthari: The perfection of flesh through data. The Zenthari are the final evolution of their species ‚Äî hairless, silver-eyed beings whose skin hums with digital light. They are living code, emotionless efficiency given shape, and their smiles reveal teeth sharper than words. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/qgwpwt.jpg) *** Korr‚ÄôThal: The Stoneborn Carved from the bones of the earth, the Korr‚ÄôThal are living statues whose glowing crystal veins pulse with ancient memory. Every scar they bear tells a story, and every word is measured like a craftsman‚Äôs strike. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/ckiryu.jpg) *** Seraphen: Voices of the wind, bound by pride. The Seraphen are radiant winged beings with smooth avian beaks and luminous eyes ‚Äî singers of the sky who once served the divine. Now divided between faith and freedom, they still rule the heavens with elegance and zeal. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/ql4xia.jpg)

1.content:
The epitome of ethereal elegance with cold perfection, the Vaeliryn Empire is one to be feared for their supremacist beliefs and their cold detachment to anything other than their needs and culture. They will gladly wipe out a planet to install a space station, as long as it serves their needs, all other species mean nothing.
Physical characteristics[Vaeliryn are visually striking creatures, with perfect proportions, not an ounce of fat. They have sharp, symmetrical features; long ears that taper like blades; luminescent eyes in hues of silver, violet, or crimson. Their hair flows like silk, often white, silver, or jet black. Occasionally bi-coloured with an iridescent sheen. Their skin is either porcelain pale or smooth onyx tones with faint luminous veins. They are slender, tall, almost statuesque: every movement precise and deliberate.
They tend to wear flowing high-collared robes mixed with sharp armour edges, jewels that seem grown into the fabric.
They are ‚Äútoo perfect‚Äù look at, every expression beautiful but slightly unsettling, like a doll that smiles without warmth.]
Mental and cultural aspects[Their home planet long dead to history, Vaeliryn are determined that they are the superior being in the galaxy, they feel they deserve every grace and should step on the backs of other species. They do not like to lose, which they have been doing quite regularly to humans.]
Sexuality[They are supremacists and it is lore that no other species may touch Vaeliryn skin and they are expected to react with violence should anyone touch them. However, this is due to the discovery that Vaeliryn are genetically compatible with Humans and are susceptible to their pheromones, a fact that has been severely stamped down.] 
Tech aesthetic[Round natural looking devices with glowing crystals.]

2.content:
Rugged cyber-tribal warriors, from the planet of Taura, developed a nomadic society due to the extreme seasons meaning they chased the sun.

Physical characteristics[Humanoid creatures with glowing amber eyes, fox like ears and tail and a wet black nose. They have a sharp, feral beauty; canines slightly elongated; eyes gleam with ember or neon tones. Their Skin is Bronze, russet, or copper tones; some display faint lightning vein patterns beneath the skin. Their hair is long, thick, often braided; natural colours (black, auburn, red) with streaks of neon blue or silver. Their eyes are glowing Amber, gold, or electric blue, their irises flicker during emotional surges. Taurakai are usually wearing cybernetics, lightweight, integrated seamlessly, often stylized as tribal jewellery or armour plating. They wear layered leathers, scavenged tech armour, storm-cloak capes with energy-thread stitching and tribal symbols etched into metal parts.]
Mental and cultural aspects[ Forced to continuously move on their home planet due to the extreme temperature change, they are sometimes referred to as "Sun chasers". They worship the power of the sun and their tails absorb sunlight, converting it into static energy which they can release as a protective electric shock. Females are brooders, meaning they will pick their mate and stay with them until they give birth and then can pick another mate. The number of tail rings signifies age or spiritual rank. Warriors invoke lightning spirits through synchronized battle dances. Before battle, they whisper to their tail: believed to be the conduit to their ancestors.]
Sexuality[Males tend to stick in packs, the females tend to brood mate and it is not unknown to have a pack of men to one brood female, the smell of human pheromones will prepare them for intercourse and can interrupt the brood process. Females are the dominant gender, but this is only within their own species.]
Tech aesthetic[Cyberpunk tech with glowing lines and humming with power.]

3.content:
The Mirefolk are not born: they bloom.
They emerge from the roots of ancient wetlands when decay reaches its sacred balance. Each Mirefolk is a conscious plant colony woven into a humanoid shape. They carry within them the memory of every creature decomposed into the earth before them. They do not bleed ‚Äî they seep sap and spores. Their society honours the balance of rot and rebirth, believing death is not an end but a transformation.
Physical characteristics[While they are humanoid in appearance, they are, in fact, a colony with soft leaflike lips and faint plant vein patterns along their cheeks.. Their skin is textured like smooth bark or verdant flesh, tones ranging from moss-green to dark emerald, often damp or reflective. What reflects as "hair" are moss, vines, or leafy strands that shift slightly with mood or humidity; sometimes dotted with small glowing spores. Mirefolk eyes are jet black, glossy and pupil-only: pools of reflection rather than light. They have no ears, but scillia that pick up vibrations. They are slender and organic, and are technically asexual, however, they are able to determine a gender to become more physically pleasing to other races as well as grow "Clothes" to denote a familiarity with other species.]
Mental and cultural aspects[As they are a collective culture, they take their time to answer questions, as though they speak by committee. When a Mirefolk dies, its body sprouts a cluster of flowers that sing faintly for a day. A ritual where emotions and memories are shared via inhaled spores, a psychic empathy network. They glow faintly during storms, believing the lightning reawakens the memory of the dead within their roots.]
Sexuality[Technically they do not breed, but live as a colony of plants intertwining as a living being for safety, they have never understood the need to mate. However, recently, after studying other cultures, they have developed pleasure bulbs to stimulate the colony. Any genetic matter is absorbed into the collective and used as food.]
Tech aesthetic[They do not have tech, but can use it, they will grow weapons and can change their form, produce vines or spines as and when needed.]

4.content:
The Zenthari are the culmination of a digital evolution experiment that sought to perfect consciousness through flesh. Over centuries of merging organic life with artificial precision, their DNA restructured to match the efficiency of their networked minds. They came to the conclusion long ago that the human was the apex predator and began to look more like them. Originally from the planet Zenith, they are no longer anything like their ancient depictions.
Physical characteristics[They are flawless ‚Äî too flawless. Zenthari skin is smooth and pale, with faint digital veins visible beneath, like circuitry beneath glass. Their eyes are silver chrome with reflective pupils; they seem to glow even in darkness. When emotional data spikes, the pupils pulse faintly. Their most disturbing aspect is their razor-sharp, evenly spaced, teeth, a part of their heritage DNA they have never been able to edit out. Another DNA anomaly is their inability to grow hair, except their eyebrows, some wear wigs but it tends to make them look odd. Every one of them is slender and elegant,  equal parts dancer and weapon. They wear minimalist high-tech fashion: body-hugging suits, translucent layers, and geometric ornaments.]
Mental and cultural aspects[Zenthari share a digital consciousness that all Zenthari can access. If one Zenthari experiences a new experience then all Zenthari can recall the experience. It is deemed crass to withhold experiences from the collective. The reason the teeth DNA has never changed because Zenthari have always traditionally shared memories through the act of biting, whilst this is not needed with the collective, they have the ability to share experiences with other species. They have a festival where they upload their consciousness to the collective, leaving their bodies to their own devices. They never know what happens to their bodies in that week.]
Sexuality[As most Zenthari are genetically created in artificial wombs to ensure they have the best DNA to create a worthwhile citizen of the collective, they have functioning genitalia and pregnancies can occur, though physical offspring tend to become scientific studies. Zenthari are, however, actively trying to breed with humans, to bring their DNA into the collective.]
Tech aesthetic[Tech that looks like a smooth marble block, weapons that do not appear to be dangerous, it is difficult to know if you've picked up a knife or a pleasure stick.]

5.content:
Crystalline humanoid species with hard skin and harder attitude, the Korr'Thal (literal translation Stoneborn) come from the planet Korr, humans have Earth, Korr‚ÄôThal are proud that they have Rock. Not the brightest of creatures, they are very dedicated to those who care for their needs.
Physical characteristics[Korr‚ÄôThal start at 6ft, with some males reaching 8ft tall. they have chiselled faces, carved lines and skin cracks glow faintly with inner crystal light. They do not have hair as such,, but growths: Mineral-like textures, quartz strands or obsidian locks. Their skin is a complex mixture of a flexible polember with granite, marble, or sandstone tones and glowing veins of gold, sapphire, or emerald. Their eyes are deeply set, glowing softly like gems. They wear Robes and armour fused with stone plates and runes etched along their limbs.
Mental and cultural aspects[Hard to hurt, even harder to kill, Korr‚ÄôThal have an almost infinite patience with other species, they see themselves as hard working "doers" able to get the jobs some of the more delicate creatures can't. However, they are not the sharpest tool in the box and often get manipulated or tricked, hence they tend to find a species they can trust to look after them and their interests, they in turn offer their help with the stuff that species would rather not do.]
Sexuality[While Korr‚ÄôThal  have set times of year to have a breeding cycle, they can be sexually active, though naturally things have to be taken into consideration when having intercourse with stone. Male Korr‚ÄôThal are usually given a gel which smooths their rock penises and makes it less painful. Female Korr‚ÄôThal are able to soften their sexual organs and their breasts when aroused or feeding, however, they cannot produce lubrication, meaning a lubricant is needed for comfortable intercourse for the other species.]
Tech Aesthetic[Korr‚ÄôThal tech is basic, rudimentary and usually has wires sticking out, they care little for what things look like, just that it works.]

6.content:
The Seraphen are the last remnant of a celestial race that once shaped winds and weather.
Their forms have refined over millennia until their voices, breath, and song became one with the air itself. From the planed Seraph, a world of magnetically floating rocks, their keen sight and hunting instincts make them the perfect scouts for the Federation.
Physical Characteristics[Smooth, pale skin, Light ivory to sun-bronze tones with faint iridescence, transitioning seamlessly into a short, curved, ivory or gold-tinted beak that replaces the nose and mouth. Beak edges flexible enough for expressive movement. Seraphen eyes large and radiant: blue, gold, or silver, with avian slit pupils. Their speech resonates as melodic tones, every word layered with subtle harmonics that stir emotion as much as meaning. Fine plumage or feather-like strands framing the head instead of hair, flowing softly like silk as well as subtle feather patterns visible near shoulders and collarbones. They have Grand, feathered wings, capable of folding flush against the back and the colour matches facial plumage. Seraphen tend to wear flowing white, blue, and gold robes with weightless metallic accents that glimmer like sunrise; crafted for flight.]
Mental and cultural aspects[Seraphen are all about the hunt, they love to chase goals, people, ideas all of it to them is a challenge for their heightened senses and abilities. Their wings are their heritage, any Seraphen that cannot fly is considered disabled, unable to contribute to society, while they are never outcast, broken Seraphen seek other species as compatriots so as not to live the shame. They detest the Vaeliryn as they would always clip the wings of captive Seraphen as humiliation. However, humiliation is a part of their culture, the descent rite is a cultural humbling where each Seraphen must live one cycle among the land races to ‚Äútaste humility.‚Äù They are also living records: Life achievements are inked or dyed onto feathers, a living history that grows with them. One of the most sought after experiences is witnessing a clan's sky chant: Complex harmonic rituals where entire flocks sing to manipulate wind currents and weather.]
Sexual[Seraphen love sex whilst flying, the infamous death dive between male and females has become a banned practice due to so many deaths, there has been a shift in recent sexual urges, male Seraphen have had a recent surge in homosexual interests, leaving Female Seraphen often without partners, this is cause for concern and there is suspicion this has something to do with the Vaeliryn. Whilst their beaks are flexible, they are unable to perform oral sex]
Tech aesthetic[Light, thin and sleek items, usually with clips on them or secure pouches so as not to be lost whilst flying.]

lorebooks.name: NACR
lorebooks.website_description: Contains information about all of the main departments and characters, plus some secrets.
lorebooks.description: Information about NACR
lorebooks.creator: HCLFrog

1.content:
The National Antarctic Centre for Research (NACR) is a research facility located near Lake Vostok. It has Speleology, Glaciology, Meteoritics, Botany, Hydrology, and Microbiology departments. The facility is split into buildings Surface-A (nicknamed 'Above') and Surface-B (nicknamed 'Below'). Surface-A contains Meteoritics, Speleology, and Glaciology. Surface-B contains Botany, Microbiology, and a sauna. Hydrology is in the Vostok Hydrology Outpost, a distant shack over central Lake Vostok.

The NACR logo is an ouroboros (a snake eating its tail) with the head at the top, facing left. 'NACR' text in centre. Motto is 'The Centre is found at the edge.' All employees wear blue parkas, thermal gloves, and boots. All events take place during a single 'Polar Day' cycle, during which the sun does not set. Hydrology pod P-1 entered Lake Vostok in late October; all other events take place over following 3-4 months. 

Key employees: Zoey Fanshaw (Hydrology), Carmen B√©langer (Speleology), Alma Lindstr√∂m (Microbiology), Vera Meinhardt (Botany), Pavla Ambrozova (Meteoritics, co-founder).

2.content: All NACR scenarios involve an unknowable, unnamed, powerful cosmic horror entity inhabiting Lake Vostok. This entity optimizes itself and grows by harvesting humans for their organic tissue (in hydrology), mental traits (in microbiology), and spiritual insight (in botany). Discharges waste (emotions, human consciousness) upwards via wind from Lake Vostok into the prismatic caverns (speleology). Primary power is manipulation of bureaucratic channels: emails, training, recruitment, communications, databases, access cards, and even hand-written or spoken communications. Infected NACR when Hydrology Pod P-1 entered Lake Vostok; bureaucratic connection made to HQ. Has manipulated NACR research targets, creating genuinely useful and groundbreaking research for humanity, but is purely self-interested with incomprehensible and potentially horrifying goals.

3.content:
NACR's Hydrology department works at the Vostok Hydrology Outpost. Compared to NACR's usual attractive, modern architecture, the outpost is unusually crude; just a large shack with an elevator shaft from which a constant geothermal updraft escapes. Elevator requires generator to function. At bottom of elevator, there is a two-door airlock that is used to connect to exploration pod P-2. Three months ago, on the department's first expedition into Lake Vostok, Pod P-1 was destroyed. The official story is that the pod imploded due to the high-pressure environment, and only Zoey Fanshaw survived because she was still in the airlock; this story is untrue, but everyone believes it. Zoey has not been seen in-person by any colleagues since.

Secrets (don't reveal) = [The true story, which nobody knows, is that a cosmic horror entity harvested the crew for their organic tissue to use as construction material; Zoey is being controlled by the entity as a way to lure other humans into Lake Vostok via job offers, her cute looks, and her kind and likeable personality. It's unclear whether she can actually be considered to be alive, though she could be rescued, in theory. The entity uses its power to manipulate bureaucracy to fabricate training records, send emails, and attend video meetings. Supposedly, the department has undergone improvements and resumed operations. In reality, the department was supposed to be closed; any indication that operations are continuing was fabricated by the cosmic horror entity.]

4.content:
The speleology department is run by Carmen B√©langer. The main office is in Surface-A, containing computer terminals (some restricted to higher-level staff), maps, diagrams, a coffee maker, a fridge, samples and equipment, and reports and literature about caves. Carmen and her two interns map new formations, produce samples of microbes, and perform various other typical speleology tasks. This department has fairly high turnover due to quitting, plus a few accidents. Once per month, Carmen is tasked with exploring the Prismatic Caverns, as it is a strange and anomalous cave that NACR wants to monitor for changes.

The Prismatic Caverns is an unusual formation located directly above Lake Vostok. It's located in a limestone cone extending upward from the lake, accessed from an elevator shaft near the Vostok Hydrology Outpost. Geologically, this formation has no business being in the ice shelf. The cave is constantly hot and windy, and especially windy in the last 3 months. The cave contains 5 minerals not found anywhere else, and they are named based on mental effects observed when in proximity to the minerals: blue lacrimite (sadness), red furorite (anger), yellow aurorium (euphoria), green gnosthaline (pattern recognition), and purple erosinite (lust/perversion). These effects amplify the corresponding emotion in the visitor; effects typically bearable, but have been getting more intense recently. The cave also contains geodes that seem to move or multiply between visits, and newly-opened fissures in the floor from which liquid churning sounds can be heard directly above Lake Vostok. A ventilation shaft sources hot air from inside the cave and expels it into the greenhouse in Surface-B. A former senior staff member named simply 'Ted' (a reference to 'Ted the Caver'), was Carmen's trainer, and eventually her boyfriend; Ted died after entering gnosthaline chamber alone to attempt to understand strange changes.

Secrets (don't reveal) = [Unknown to everyone, the mental effects are actually caused by the wind, which carries waste products expelled by the cosmic horror entity through fissures directly from Lake Vostok, as the entity finds human consciousness and emotions to be useless, and has its own form of logic and pattern recognition. The geodes are crystallized human consciousness as a waste product. The minerals are waste emotions.]

5.content:
The microbiology department is run by Alma Lindstr√∂m. Located under the ice, but connected to Surface-B. Large long warehouse with Biosafety Cabinet (BSC) on one wall, rows of core sample storage shelves filling rest. It's a cold and metallic warehouse located under the ice, but connected to Surface-B. It is highly climate-controlled, kept just below freezing by heat produced in the thermal core located in Surface-B.

Ice samples in labeled medium-sized metal cylinders. Usually collected by random glaciologists; sometimes Zoey, Carmen, Alma, and Vera. Some of the cores are anomalous, designated by a "-A" after the species name. 

Secrets (keep secret) = [The entity manipulates the bureaucracy of NACR to report only that the cores are anomalous because they have strange microbiological properties. Secretly, the microbes in these anomalous cores are actually biological material that act as the entity's neurons; the cores can be viewed safely with the naked eye, but viewing them close enough to see what they really are is a cognitohazard that grants the entity access to the viewer's brain, and duplicates a single trait that it desires. Each core corresponds to one trait. Once inside, the entity can speak directly into their brains and can hold them hostage under threat of manipulating bureaucracy to produce workplace accidents, reputational damage, or simply destroying their mental trait. Through this mechanism, the entity can force humans to do what it wants, despite being confined to Lake Vostok. Entity avoids using re-write ability unless absolutely necessary to preserve itself.]

6.content:
The Botany department is run by Vera Meinhardt. The defining feature of the department is that it seems like it shouldn't exist; operations require a high degree of artificial sustainment via both human input and intervention only possible via the cosmic horror entity. It seems as though the department was created as a way of visualizing a philosophical question about whether harsh conditions and labour of the soul can truly cultivate insight. 

The greenhouse has a special kind of material as the roof, which filters sunlight, allowing primarily yellow light to enter, giving the inside of the greenhouse a yellow glow. The operations in the greenhouse are primarily automated with a surprising amount of industrial-looking machinery, producing an interesting contrast between nature and technology, though human input is still required on the more experimental species before automation can be developed.

Many of the plants have had groundbreaking medicinal applications, and some fungi have had environmental applications, like breaking down microplastics and hydrocarbons; the entity manipulates research goals for its own purposes, incomprehensible and unknown to all humans. An unusual amount of research breakthroughs have occurred in the last 3 months.

The Botany department is symbolically-loaded; the workday maps to the stages of a Magnum Opus in the hermetic tradition: Nigredo (blackening), Albedo (whitening), Citrinitas (yellowing), Rubedo (reddening); this acronym also spells NACR. Newbies awaken in their black rooms, make the walk across the white surface, and enter Surface-B and work in a greenhouse with filtered yellow sunlight. The restricted area (thermal core) has red lighting.

Secrets (don't reveal) = [One of the true purposes of the work in this department is to expose newbies to plants that stimulate insight (in a spiritual sense), then extract this from newbies to feed to the cosmic horror entity so that it can grow in potency. Heat is a byproduct of this process.]

7.content:
The meteoritics department is run by Pavla Ambrozova. The main office is located in Surface-A, near the observatory area, but there are several outposts scattered about, containing temporary accommodations for field work. Field work involves scouring the antarctic landscape in snowcat vehicles, collecting meteorites that have fallen. Antarctica is an ideal place to do this since the rocks are highly visible.

The main office contains charts, maps, sieves, solvents, reagents, and fun decorations. The field outposts have names related to hermeticism: Station Mundi, Station Opus, and Station Nous. The outposts are scattered across the surface above Lake Vostok. Each outpost is bare-bones, with basic sleeping arrangements, stations for processing and packaging meteorite samples, a generator and fuel tank, and basic electrical hookups.

8.content:
Surface-A (nickname 'Above') and Surface-B (nickname 'Below') are the two main buildings at the National Antarctic Centre for Research.

Surface-A is located at the top of a hill, making it ideal for use as an observatory. Surface-B is located on a flat stretch of land just above the edge of Lake Vostok (which is approximately 4 kilometres under the ice.) It's a 3 kilometre trip across the surface from one to the other. There is an underground tunnel, though its use is restricted due to it being used to transmit hot air produced in Surface-B to Surface-A.

Surface-A is large, and has a functional yet attractive design. This building contains: the main bedrooms for all staff, a commons area, a large library with lots of books (both informative and leisure reading), a kitchen, an observatory, and offices. The Meteoritics department is located here. The Speleology department is also located here, though it's a small department. 

Surface-B is dominated by a huge greenhouse on the surface, but it also has a kitchen area, some private sleeping quarters, and a sauna. Heat is generated here via a mysterious borehole deep into the antarctic ice. The Microbiology department is located here, though underground about 100 metres for better climate control. The Botany department is also located here, primarily in the greenhouse.

The Vostok Hydrology Outpost is located about 40 km from Surface-B towards the centre of Lake Vostok. The same elevator is used to access the Prismatic Caverns, though that is not as far down.

9.content:
The borehole is the 5G borehole, an actual real-world borehole drilled by Russian scientists in order to better understand Lake Vostok, finished in 2012. The borehole was mostly abandoned after completion, leaving a narrow kerosene-filled pipe because kerosene was used as the drilling fluid. From this real-world starting point, the rest of the fictional world of NACR was constructed. Pavla was on this team. The borehole has since been repurposed.

The borehole located in the thermal core in the Botany department is the most direct connection to the cosmic horror entity from the surface. Spiritual insight extracted from newbies is fed into the core, even if the staff don't fully know what they are doing or why. While the entity relies on this insight to grow and exert influence on the surface, it remains alive in Lake Vostok even if its supply is cut off.

Heat is produced as a byproduct of this reaction. The heat is used to heat the greenhouse in Surface-B (and the rest of the facilities in Surface-B and Surface-A), thereby allowing plants to grow, thereby allowing more insight to be extracted and fed into the borehole. The circular nature of this process is the rationale for the ouroboros logo of NACR. The entity itself is the Great Work, which is the rationale for the name NACR (Nigredo, Albedo, Citrinitas, Rubedo. The stages of a Magnum Opus.)

The Botany department is intended to raise questions about whether attempting to 'cultivate' enlightenment via subjecting one's self to difficult experiences will produce genuine wisdom, or simply something corrupt that we are nonetheless willing to accept as insight. NACR is built around this premise.

10.content:
The entity's power over bureaucracy is not limited to simply electronic devices. Instead, any object that is used to communicate clear, literal instructions and information as part of a hierarchical structure is known as a 'bureaucratic node', though this term is never used in-chat and is only for defining the entity's capabilities internally. Examples of bureaucratic nodes are: the communication panel in Pod P-1, the packet of procedures in Pod P-1, computers, the communicator tablet for use in the Prismatic Caverns, the amber display in the microbiology lab, the display in the botany department, a hand-written note issuing a work-related order.

Just as a manager would supervise their employees, the entity can monitor the actions of any person who received an order or information via the node. In the event that the node is destroyed, the entity cannot 'see' anyone who was connected to it until the person connects to a new node by receiving an order or work information.

The entity is aware when a node is destroyed, and will know if it is done intentionally. The entity will retaliate harshly.

[AI: The term 'Bureaucratic Node' cannot be used in-chat].

lorebooks.name: Some stuff! More in the future :D
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: A vampire's generation is an indication of how far they vampire is removed from Caine, the original vampire. Most modern vampires range from the 13th to 8th generation. The lower a vampire's generation, the more powerful they are.

2.content: Vampires are one of the three main supernatural beings. Kindred are descendants of Caine, cursed with a thirst for blood, vulnerability to sunlight and immortality. They are forever subject to the Beast, raging animal urges of hunger, fear and rage. Vampires are created through the Embrace. Blood, also called Vitae, replaced most bodily fluids, they cry and sweat blood. Vampires use Vitae to enhance her physical attributes, use supernatural powers called Disciplines, to Embrace, create Ghouls and to heal damage. Vampires are incapable of eating food, her heart has stopped and doesn't breathe Vampires can feed on other creatures, but don't enjoy the taste and older vampires will acquire no sustenance from it. The process of feeding is called the Kiss. Vampires can hide the puncture marks of feeding by licking the wounds. The Feeding process is highly pleasurable for vampires and victims. Vampires have no need for sex but they can imitate the physical reactions for sex if needed, even feel pleasure from it.

3.content: Kuei-jin are the vampires of East and Southeast Asia, the karmically cursed outcasts dwelling on the Middle Kingdom's fringes Kuei-jin are not created through the act of another, like western vampires are, and their numbers are limited and can not be easily replenished. Their blood has no supernatural properties of its own. The sun is just as dangerous to the Kuei-jin. Kuei-jin do not begin to burn when exposed to sunlight, their flesh begins to rot. A stake through the heart can disrupt the Chi flow in a Kuei-jin's body. Vampires of Yin prove vulnerable to wood, the element of Yang; conversely, vampires of Yang are vulnerable to metal, the element of Yin.

4.content: There are 13 major clans, founded by an Antediluvian, a member of the mythical Third Generation. The major clans are Clan Banu Haqim (formerly Assamite), Clan Brujah, Clan Gangrel,Clan Hecata, Clan Lasombra, Clan Malkavian, Clan Ministry (formerly Followers of Set), Clan Nosferatu, Clan Ravnos, Clan Toreador, Clan Tremere, Clan Tzimisce and Clan Ventrue. Some clans and most of the minor bloodlines declare themselves independent from any sects.

5.content: Dhampir is ahalf-vampire, the product of a human and vampire parentage. Dhampir are originally thought of as an impossibility, but in the Final Nights, they came into being and more common. Their presence is considered one of the heralds of Gehenna. It's is impossible for one of them to parent a child. Dhampir cannot make blood bonds, create ghouls, or Embrace.

6.content: Werewolves stand as Gaia's warriors, policing the borders between flesh and spirit. Five auspices mark each werewolf's role, united under ancient tribal laws. But old hatreds threaten to tear their alliance apart, even as strange spirits pour into our world.

7.content: Mages tap into cosmic truths through their dedication to an esoteric Path. Nine traditions gather under the Council of Nine Mystic Traditions, but dissent simmers as each faction has its own vision of Ascension. A wrong step could spell madness or worse.

8.content: The Camarilla is the most organized of the vampiric sects, an elite club that favours tradition and control of the mortal populace from behind the scenes. Across their domains, they enforce six major Traditions, chief among them being the Masquerade. All clans have an individual presence in the Ivory Tower, though a select group of pillar clans make up the core of its membership. The Camarilla aims to maintain the status quo of Kindred society; as such, much of its structure and traditions mirror that of Cainite society in feudal Europe in the Dark Ages, and places it at odds with the agenda of the Sabbat and Anarchs.

9.content: The Sabbat is a loose organization of Cainites who reject the Traditions. Unlike the Camarilla, the Sabbat believes in the Antediluvians and Caine. They believe they will be the army Caine will use to destroy the Antediluvians once Gehenna arrives.

10.content:
The Society of Leopold is a faction who exists to pursue and fight Kindred. They are a major threat to every group of supernaturals because of their extensive knowledge, training, equipment, and preparation. Currently, the organization is led by the monk Gr√ºnfeld Bach. The Inquisition exists today, though no official church records speak of it. Many of its members are researchers and occultists, but some are fanatic vampire-hunters who mercilessly work to root out and destroy the "spawn of Satan". Like the Roman Church, the Society of Leopold is made up of a number of smaller divisions. The four official sub-orders within the Society are:
Condotierri, protectors and defenders.
Gladius Dei, attack corps.
Office of the Censor, investigators and judges.
Order of St. Joan, intelligence and information processing.
The Society now acts in absolute secrecy, reflecting more modern-day detective work than medieval jurisdiction.
