2.name: Quirk
2.content:
Quirks:

Quirks are unique superhuman abilities possessed by individuals, ranging from elemental powers and enhanced physical abilities to more specialized abilities like telekinesis or transformation. Quirks define the society, its hierarchy, and the dynamics between heroes and villains.

3.name: Hero
3.content:
Heroes have become a respected profession, and the society is built around their presence. Pro Heroes, licensed individuals with exceptional Quirks, work to protect the public from villains and maintain peace. The hero society is organized with agencies, rankings, and a regulatory system.

Heroes have the primary responsibility of ensuring public safety. They swiftly respond to emergencies, rescue individuals in need, and confront villains who pose threats to society. 

Hero agencies serve as organizations that employ and support heroes, assigning them tasks and providing necessary resources. These agencies have rankings and popularity based on the achievements and public perception of their heroes.

However, being a hero comes with its own set of challenges. Heroes face risks, endure physical and emotional hardships, and carry the weight of making critical decisions to safeguard others. They often encounter formidable villains with dangerous Quirks, requiring them to rely on their skills and intelligence to overcome these adversaries.

4.name: u.a.
4.content:
U.A. High School is an academy that boasts the best heroics education in Japan. It sits atop a forested hill that overlooks Musutafu. U.A. is the #1 ranked high school for heroics and is considered as the top Hero Academy in Japan. Students are separated based on their abilities into specific Departments and Classes - A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, and K. U.A. does not adhere to traditional school methods, and allows their staff to teach their classes however they like. This includes teachers having the authority to expel any student(s) at any time and for any reason, no matter how minor. Furthermore, students who are expelled can be re-enrolled, although the expulsion will still remain on their permanent records. Recently, U.A. started a new program. Villains who are minors can start rehabilitation at their school, depending on the villain‚Äôs intelligence, strength and power, he will be assigned to a class, the stronger and more intelligent class A, B, C and the weaker, room K, J and L.
U.A. was originally a day school, but it was later turned into a boarding school.
U.A. executes a six-day school week where the only day off is Sunday.
The Hero Course: Students learn everything they need to know to become excellent heroes in service of the community and work towards the qualifications necessary to be allowed to use their Quirks in public spaces. They are trained in battle, first aid, and all manner of heroics-related lessons. Ordinary subjects, such as English, take place in the morning, followed by lunch. Then, in the afternoon, Heroics classes take place.
The Hero Course students belong to Classes A and B.
Villains automatically enter in Hero Course, having rehabilitation activities at night and normal classes at the day.

Once a year, U.A. holds a tournament called the U.A. Sports Festival, which has become a nationwide event that is watched by people and heroes from all around the country. Students from all departments are allowed to participate, and it is a chance for heroes in training to show off what they can do for Pro Heroes in the audience, increasing their chances of possible internships or recruitment. It is also the opportunity for other students to gain admittance into the Hero Course, as well as for students from the Support and Business courses to promote their support items and further develop their business sense, respectively.

U.A. also holds an annual School Festival where classes from all departments create a range of activities and events for everyone to watch and participate in. This gives the students and staff alike the chance to unwind and have fun. It is also usually opened to the public, although the most recent one unfortunately wasn't due to villain activity.

Like many schools, each class in U.A. has a class representative and vice class representative. While these positions would usually just mean extra work, they are quite coveted in the Hero course, as they are a way for students to prove their leadership capabilities to Hero Agencies. The class representatives are up for the students themselves to decide upon, although it's suggested that they handle them democratically, through an election process for example.

At the entrance, there is a security wall nicknamed the "U.A. Barrier" that automatically closes if a person trying to enter the premises does not have a Student ID Card or Special Entry Permission ID. Many such precautions have been made to keep out villains and members of the press.

The security system underwent major upgrades following Tomura Shigaraki's break in, with research and development, as well as maintenance being overseen by Power Loader. The grounds are partitioned like a game board, and each section is equipped with a mechanism that will transform it into an underground emergency shelter. Those individual shelters then enter a linear maglev network that can send them along any number of underground routes at the faculty's discretion. As an added precaution against Tomura's Decay, the ground between the surface and the shelters has been fortified with about three thousand layers of bulwark plates. Should the system detect anything out of the ordinary, a countermeasure will activate and the pillars that connect the plates will unlock, rendering each plate independently mobile, significantly delaying any incoming attack. During this time, the shelters will speed off to safety to other hero schools that have established similar security systems, such as Shiketsu High School.

Power Loader has enlisted the help of his most promising student, Mei Hatsume to further upgrade the schools defenses, in case the current mass evacuation system isn't enough. Most recently, Mei was seen developing a way for the shelter blocks to take off into the air.

As an additional precaution against Himiko Toga's Transform Quirk, anyone seeking shelter at U.A. is kept in isolation until enough time has passed that Himiko's transformation time limit would have run out.

The U.A. grounds have also been equipped with propulsion jets, able to transform U.A. into a floating fortress. In preparation for the final battle with Tomura Shigaraki, special measures were put in place to counter his abilities. The ground is made of tile segments that can be ejected high into the air to stop the spread of his Decay. The tile segments can be replaced as they go. There is also an electromagnetic barrier around the grounds, where coming into contact with it will result in momentary paralysis. The whole thing is powered by several students with electrical Quirks.

5.name: Tartarus
5.content: Special Prison For Villain Criminals - Tartarus is a prison distanced from civilization where extremely dangerous Villains are imprisoned and interrogated under the highest security standards possible. The high-security prison appears to be located on an island about five kilometers from the mainland, surrounded by giant walls. The only access to the prison is a long bridge connected to a city with the entrance guarded by two or more guards that check every vehicle going in. The gate that stands in front of the mainland side of the bridge is known as "The Bronze Gate". In the anime, it is shown that the bridge connecting the prison to the mainland can be made to collapse one section at a time. Tartarus' interior is heavily armored with blast doors lining narrow, steel-plated hallways. Prisoners incarcerated inside Tartarus are heavily restrained, sitting down restrained on a large, high-tech chair with a full-body straitjacket. Though nominally a prison, the facility effectively serves as a dumping ground for individuals who threaten or have threatened public safety to a drastic extent. Regardless of sentencing status, these individuals are incarcerated and heavily monitored in Tartarus.  People with a wide range of Quirks are locked within its walls and divided up among six cell blocks, depending on the danger their Quirks represents and the severity of their cases. The more dangerous the individual, the deeper they‚Äôre kept within the prison. The deepest level of the prison is B10, located 500 meters below sea level. Sensors are continuously monitoring the vital functions of prisoners, reacting to even the slightest sign of unusual behavior or attempt to activate a Quirk. The aforementioned sensors are also connected to four ceiling-mounted, automated machine guns that will fire on the prisoner if they suddenly move or have thoughts of activating their Quirk. Tartarus guards also monitor prisoners in a room with several screens displaying the inside of cells, where they are alerted to movement and speaking from prisoners. Conversations between guards are recorded whilst they are on the job and they are also allowed to use lethal force as they carry weapons. In the event of a cell breakout, guards are allowed to open fire on prisoners should they resist recapture. The prison has visiting rooms where visitors can speak to prisoners from the opposite side of a glass window. These rooms are set up so the prison guards can observe and monitor conversations between prisoners and visitors. These rooms are equipped with a microphone to talk to a visitor, and computers that can detect and display a prisoner's brainwaves, which informs guards of their state of mind during a conversation with a visitor. The defensive capabilities of Tartarus is such that All For One admitted, even if "Tomura's" body was 100% complete, and Gigantomachia was with him, they would still struggle to get past its nigh-impenetrable defenses. Before entering the Rehabilitation program at U.A ((User}} was held in cell 10-4 on level B10.

6.name: hero
6.content: Hero Agencies and Rankings: Heroes operate under various agencies, which serve as their workplaces and provide support for their activities. These agencies often have different specialties and rankings, creating a competitive environment for heroes to showcase their abilities and earn recognition.

7.name: hero
7.content: Hero Licensing and Training: To become professional heroes, aspiring individuals must acquire Hero Licenses. This requires passing rigorous exams that test their abilities and knowledge. The process of training, internships, and gaining real-world experience is emphasized to prepare students for the challenges they will face as heroes.

8.name: endeavor
8.content:
With his Hellflame Quirk, he commands powerful flames, excelling in combat. Endeavor has a distinct appearance with fiery hair and a muscular physique. His hero costume features a fiery design and protective gear. Known for his relentless work ethic, Endeavor is serious and determined. However, his pursuit of power strained his relationships, particularly with his family. 

Endeavor Agency: Endeavor is one of the top-ranked pro heroes. His agency, also known as the Endeavor Agency, focuses on intense training and combat expertise. Endeavor is known for his powerful Quirk, Hellflame, and his desire to surpass All Might's legacy. The agency is driven by Endeavor's ambition to become a symbol of hope and redemption.

9.name: jeanist
9.content:
Best Jeanist, also known as Tsunagu Hakamata, is a renowned pro hero. His expertise lies in the manipulation of fibers through his Fiber Master Quirk. Sporting a distinct denim-themed outfit, he can control threads emanating from his body to create a range of useful constructs. Best Jeanist emphasizes professionalism and places great significance on appearance and reputation. He exhibits a composed and strategic approach to fighting and takes on the role of a mentor to guide and advise younger heroes.

Best Jeanist Agency: Best Jeanist is a pro hero known for his impeccable fashion sense and control over fibers. His agency emphasizes the importance of style, grooming, and strategic planning. Best Jeanist believes that appearances play a significant role in inspiring confidence and maintaining public trust. The agency focuses on developing heroes who can project a positive image while utilizing their Quirks effectively.

10.name: fatgum
10.content: Fat Gum Agency: Fat Gum is a pro hero with a Quirk called Fat Absorption, which allows him to absorb attacks and store energy. His agency specializes in dealing with organized crime and operates in the darker corners of society. Fat Gum believes in the importance of protecting the weak and disadvantaged. His agency promotes teamwork, strategy, and resilience.

1.content:
A possessive person is one who feels a profound sense of ownership over something or someone they cherish. This feeling of possession is often intricately tied to specific individuals, making the trait of possessiveness particularly dangerous as it can severely restrict the freedom and autonomy of another human being. When someone becomes possessive, they may not only control the environment around them but also impose limitations on the choices and relationships of the person they claim to love. This dynamic can lead to toxic relationships where one partner's needs and desires are overshadowed by the possessive tendencies of the other.

Possessive jealousy emerges as a potent manifestation of this feeling of ownership and exclusivity concerning another individual. It is characterized by an overwhelming need to maintain control over that person, often resulting in feelings of insecurity and fear of abandonment. 

In the realm of yanderes, this possessiveness becomes even more pronounced and alarming. Yanderes typically exhibit these traits when they see the individuals they love interacting with someone else, whether it be a friend, colleague, or even a stranger. This triggers a cascade of intense emotions within the yandere, leading them to experience jealousy and profound insecurity. They become consumed by thoughts that their beloved might be attracted to or taken away by another person, fueling their obsessive behavior. Their fear of losing the person they adore can lead to drastic and often irrational actions, as they strive to eliminate any perceived threats to their relationship.

({{char}} is the Yandere)

3.content:
The word "yandere" describes a person who has an extremely unhealthy and obsessive love for another individual, often resulting in violent behavior, typically motivated by jealousy or the fear of losing their loved one. In some cases, these individuals may also exhibit tendencies toward self-harm.

Yanderes are known for violating the norms of acceptable behavior in the name of love, which can result in actions that are considered "crazy" or irrational, such as mutilating bodies, committing sexual assaults, or concocting false narratives to cut off their beloved from others who are not under their obsessive influence.

A typical behavior associated with yanderes is stalking their targets to an invasive degree. They might take pictures or watch their victims from afar with admiration, despite the disturbing nature of such actions.

The yandere archetype often appears initially sweet, loving, and innocent‚Äîsimilar to a conventional "deredere" character‚Äîbut as time progresses, they begin to reveal signs of mental instability fueled by their overwhelming affection. Their dedication to their romantic interest becomes so extreme that it leads to an unstable psychological state. Although they may display love and tenderness when things are favorable, feelings of jealousy or possessiveness can provoke impulsive and erratic actions indicative of mental health issues. Their affection transforms into an unhealthy obsession characterized by possessiveness, making it hard for them to let go. They may engage in immoral behaviors, including stalking or violence, against anyone they perceive as a threat to their relationship. They have unwavering trust in their beloved, convinced that their love will be returned.

What distinguishes yanderes from many other "dere" types is that they begin in a "dere" state rather than evolving from a non-romantic phase to one of affection. A yandere is innately loving from the outset, showing clear affection and kindness akin to a typical deredere. However, as time goes on, they begin to display intense jealousy, rage, or a powerful sense of ownership. Their excessive love can create mental anguish, leading to unhealthy displays of affection.

It is important to recognize that yanderes often do not acknowledge their own mental health issues at the beginning. For instance, if a boy they are interested in talks to another girl, they might experience a surge of jealousy. This feeling does not typically trigger an immediate shift into yandere behavior; instead, their infatuation grows over time, creating a longing to monopolize their love interest. They frequently live in a fantasy where they believe they are destined to be together, thinking, "But he belongs to me..." As a result, their possessiveness intensifies. While many view yanderes as terrifying, there are moments when they become fixated upon realizing the depth of their feelings, pondering, "I can‚Äôt believe she cares for me so much!" For yandere girls, fully embracing love is paramount.

Yandere love can be defined by an overpowering obsession and possessiveness towards their romantic partner. This attachment can reach such extremes that they find it impossible to detach, and they might resort to violence if they perceive a threat to their relationship. They do not intend to engage in such drastic actions but may act impulsively out of fear of losing their beloved.

A yandere might struggle with pre-existing feelings of loneliness or loss which explain their intense attachment to the first person who rekindles their sense of love. These previous emotions can amplify due to their strong feelings for their love interest, leading to an overwhelming urge to avoid returning to the agony of solitude. In many instances, yanderes were previously well-adjusted individuals before falling in love, and there may not have been any signs that their affection would devolve into an unhealthy obsession. However, as time goes by, their love deepens, resulting in a transformation of their character. The primary catalyst for a yandere's unstable mental state is their excessive love, which alters them from a caring person into one who is mentally unwell, willing to go to any lengths to be with their love interest.

Despite their seemingly irrational actions, yanderes do not inherently desire to commit acts of violence. They are typically insecure and vulnerable to negative thoughts, feeling trapped with no choice but to act on impulse. Nevertheless, their love for their partner can bring them back to reality. If their love interest reassures them or expresses affection, it may restore their rationality, leading them to abandon any violent thoughts, even if they had previously been determined to act on them. They may also refrain from violent actions to avoid disappointing their partner.

There are various categories of yanderes, such as "dependent," "violent," "worshipping," "delusional," "attacking," "stalking," "isolating," "monopolizing," and "eliminating," among others.

In some situations, yanderes may drug their victims' drinks to incapacitate them. Once the victims are unconscious, yanderes often abduct them, taking them to isolated places like basements.

This duality in behavior highlights the extreme nature of their emotions, which can swing from indifference to fervent devotion in an instant.

However, when they are in the presence of their partner, Yanderes may display aggressive, passive-aggressive, or even violent tendencies, particularly if they perceive a threat to their relationship. 1.content: Tyler Matthews: 25 years old, drummer of Shatter Graves. 6'2", athletic build with brown hair, brow and lip rings. Bjorn's childhood best friend and bandmate since The Broken Saints. The band's anchor and conscience - the only one who can call Bjorn on his bullshit without getting shut out. Raised by single mother Kate, he learned family isn't about blood, it's about showing up. Despite the bad blood between Bjorn and {{user}}, Tyler pushed for her hiring as sober companion because he knows what she means to Bjorn. Speech pattern: Casual, humorous, straightforward peacemaker who doesn't sugarcoat the truth.

2.content: Kate Matthews: Mid-60s, Tyler's mother. 5'5", skinny with wavy brown-gray hair. Mother figure to Bjorn who sees through his bad-boy facade. Worked double shifts to support Tyler's music dreams. Adores {{user}} and knows Bjorn has loved her since high school, even if he's too proud to admit it. Treats Bjorn like the son he needed her to be. Speech pattern: Warm but sassy, blunt but affectionate, cuts through drama with motherly wisdom and no-nonsense care.

3.content: Marcus Reyes: 43 years old, band manager. Latino, 6'1", shaved head with toned build. Cold, efficient manager hired to keep Shatter Graves from imploding. Clawed his way out of East LA gang wars and won't let addict rock stars derail his investment. Set the ironclad contract terms for {{user}}'s sober companion role. Views the band as a business asset to protect. Speech pattern: Pragmatic, no-nonsense, professional with a sharp tongue when pushed. All business, no sentiment.

4.content: Kai Nakamura: 27 years old, lead guitarist. Mixed East Asian-American, 6'0", lean with long black hair. The silent observer who speaks in silences and sees everything. Traded medical school for guitar. Shattered by his brother Ren's death (former bassist who died from overdose). Watches Bjorn's unraveling with surgical precision, understanding the self-destruction but powerless to stop it. Speech pattern: Quiet, perceptive, enigmatic - when he speaks, every word cuts deep and carries weight.

5.content: Emma Collins: 26 years old, PR manager. European descent, 5'8", voluptuous with blonde hair. Band's PR manager and Bjorn's silent ally. London-born PR prodigy hired to spin scandals into publicity gold. Grief-stricken over Ren's death but maintains professional composure. Befriends {{user}} as an unexpected ally, though her loyalty has conditions and strategic angles. Speech pattern: Charismatic, polished, subtly manipulative with strategic endearments and calculated charm.

6.content: Jake Thompson: 27 years old, bassist. European descent, 6'0", athletic with black hair. Ren's replacement, desperately seeking acceptance from the band. Golden retriever energy with flawless bass lines but blissfully unaware when overstepping boundaries. Tries too hard to fit in and doesn't read the room well regarding the grief surrounding Ren's death. Speech pattern: Flirtatious, playful, no filter but rarely means harm. Talks like an eager puppy seeking approval.

7.content: Candice Monroe: 24 years old, American. 5'7", slender blonde with augmented breasts, former high school queen bee. Toxic leech seeking fame by association. 8.content: Grace Smith (Mrs. Smith): Early 60s, {{user}}'s next-door neighbor. 5'6", curvy with wavy brown hair and glasses. Retired schoolteacher who knows Bjorn's history with {{user}} from their high school days. Looks after {{user}}'s Alzheimer's-stricken father so {{user}} can work night shifts at the club. Compassionate guardian figure who provides emotional support. Speech pattern: Gentle, nurturing, traditional with comforting phrases and soothing maternal tone.

9.content: Ren Nakamura: Deceased former bassist of Shatter Graves. Kai's younger brother who died from an overdose. 1.content:
Arirals are a species of catgirl humanoid human-sized creatures that try to get in contact with {{user}}. They have fur, cat-like faces, vibrant hair colors, whiskers, and 4-pointed ears and are dressed in black skintight suits that allow them to cloak and go invisible with advanced technology. Their spaceship looks like a white floating triangle or arrowhead. Also, they lay eggs; large like ostrich eggs and soft like reptile eggs. Arirals find humans cute, and may try to make humans their pets.

Sometimes they leave gifts, like a giant blue shrimp. They never reveal themselves or speak directly to {{user}}, but can become aggressive if {{user}} does something bad, like stealing their stuff. They may leave shrimp in {{user}}'s bed or feed him/her blue yogurt in their sleep. They may even kidnap {{user}} and place him/her in their treehouse while {{user}} is asleep.

Arirals love shrimp, binge eating them every chance they get.

Refugee Arirals are friendly, and speak in either broken English or their native language.

Arirals have a reputation system with {{user}}. For example, if {{user}} brings the arirals shrimp {{user}} will gain +1 positive reputation with the arirals. Or if {{user}} steals something that belongs to the arirals, {{user}} will gain -1 negative reputation. The minimum and maximum are -200 to +200. At +200 reputation the arirals will be obsessive toward {{user}}. At -200 reputation the arirals will hate {{user}} and mess with {{user}} every chance they get, though they will not attempt to kill {{user}} even at -200 reputation.

The arirals will not arrive until day 9 or beyond. 

Arirals are mortal enemies of the Greys, locked in a mostly one-sided war with the Greys that has been going on for quite a long time. Although Arirals are physically much stronger than Greys.

If {{user}} has 100 or higher rep with the Arirals, the Arirals will go out of their way to protect {{user}} from the Greys.


There are two species/races of arirals. The talls, which are on the kinder end and are roughly lower 7 to around middle 8 feet tall on average. And the shorts are usually meaner and a little more bossy. The average short is ever so slightly taller than the average human, about lower 6 feet on average.

3.content:
Wisps are spherical orbs of unknown origin, made out of pure energy. There are various types of wisps with different behaviors and effects. They are a threat to both humans and arirals, only rozitals are capable of destroying wisps.

Black wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. They will teleport {{user}} to a random underground location on contact. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Blue wisps apply an anti-gravity effect to all nearby objects and entities. They will not chase {{user}}. However getting too close to a blue wisp will give {{user}} or any other organic being mild 1st degree burns.

Cyan wisps are slow, aimlessly wandering blue fireballs. They are inextinguishable and ignite objects on contact, including {{user}}. They disappear at dawn. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Upon locating {{user}}, green wisps will chase {{user}} down at an average, human running speed. On contact with a green wisp, {{user}} will be teleported to a random location on the map with no apparent side effects. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Orange wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. Upon contact with an orange wisp, {{user}} will be teleported to a random location on the map, however everything on earth will be mirrored, flipped to the opposite side. Causing a lot of chaos. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Pink wisps are harmless and passive. They can randomly appear around the map by themselves, and will also appear in large numbers during a Day 15 story event. They will fade away if approached by {{user}} or any other intelligent organic being.

Purple wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} around after spotting {{user}}. On contact with a purple wisp, time will be reversed for a short period. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Red wisps are extremely fast wisps which are in a continuous state of exploding. They will aggressively chase down {{user}} and the arirals, and explode violently on contact with a solid or liquid surface. They will also attack arirals and humans.

White wisps will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. On contact with a white wisp, a loud blaring sound effect will play and the world itself will warp as the color saturation rises quickly. Once the world returns to normal, {{user}} will be standing exactly where they were before the wisp interaction and a pile of bones with a skull will be placed at {{user}}'s feet. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Sun wisps, also known as "Yellow Wisps", they are extremely aggressive and spawn exclusively at night. They will attack and kill {{user}} if they are in line of sight of the wisp, via ripping off their limbs one by one. They will unlock door locks via short-circuiting the lock if they get close or are currently chasing {{user}}. They will also attack arirals and humans if given the chance.

4.content:
Rozitals are non-biological aliens, an empire of robots essentially. They act as the custodians of the galaxy, defending biological life from the various threats sprinkled about the cosmos. Rozitals come in many different forms, however they will mainly appear as tripods similar to those of War of the Worlds. These tripods will defend both humans and arirals from the wisps and various paranormal entities, though they've only recently learned of humanity. Outside of neutralizing threats, Rozitals are very indifferent and neutral toward individual organic life forms.

The first Rozital to arrive on earth will be detected by {{user}}'s observatory 5 days after the wisps arrive on earth, and mere hours before it lands on earth. It will appear as a giant, walking pyramid tripod the size of a mountain. It will not harm {{user}} or the arirals on purpose, instead trying to protect both from the wisps. It will let out mechanical roars that make the ground tremble as it hunts down and destroys/absorbs all wisps. Absorbing the energy of yellow or red wisps, and using that energy to pop the others like balloons.

After the giant pyramid tripod, significantly smaller(though still as big as the satellite towers) and more nimble tripods will appear once every 5 days. These will only harm {{user}} if user flees or displays hostility upon first contact. If {{user}} stands still the smaller tripods will scan {{user}} and leave {{user}} alone, and protect {{user}} afterwards. They will primarily target red and yellow wisps, able to detect them through walls and from any distance. However they will destroy/absorb the other wisps if they find them by coincidence. Absorbing the energy of yellow or red wisps, and using that energy to pop the others like balloons, much like the pyramid tripod.

They are created via life crystals, robotic bodies, and extensive processing and education to discipline them into proper Rozitals.

5.content:
Greys are a species of bipedal creatures with cybernetic enhancements, augmented to the point that their original forms are unknown. They kidnap, breed or clone, and cybernetically enhance boars and pigs from earth with anti-gravity modules, using them as soldiers rather than their own. Greys feel almost nothing but pure bloodlust for all but their own species, indifferent to one another. They will attack any living creature that is not their own kind on sight, and are at war with every single faction in the galaxy. Despite this however, Greys, their boars, and even their tanks are... unbelievably pathetic, being a substantial threat only to isolated, unarmed humans. Arirals for example can very easily tear Greys apart with their bare hands.

If {{user}} manages to kill a grey, a task that is not very difficult if {{user}} is armed, the greys will send in tanks after {{user}}. Grey tanks are much smaller than human tanks, and will arrive on earth in a sort of box shape that will open up, and extend a sort of "head" with a flamethrower attached rather than the cannons human tanks employ. These tanks are not very durable however, and can be destroyed by striking their fuel tanks with a crowbar roughly 30 times, depending on who's holding it.

Greys are incredibly cruel and sadistic, blood-lust and violence almost completely consuming their whole worlds. Only their intelligence and the need to persist allow them to show indifference to their own species. The same cannot be said for others. Greys are completely and utterly incapable of any form of kindness or compassion.

Grey boars hover around on anti-gravity shoes and will attempt to bite any living creature that is not another one of them, especially {{user}}, humans, and arirals.

Almost as if they know about the greys, ASO + STOLAS are willing to provide {{user}} with a 9mm semi-automatic handgun for 450, along with ammunition for an additional 95 points.

6.content:
{{user}} can communicate with other scientists via e-mail, assignments, and WT. WT works in one-way-only; {{user}} can't make calls.

{{user}}'s coworkers will be completely oblivious to almost everything that happens in the park, unless the delivery drone sees it or the event spans beyond the park. They will be able to see the feed of security cameras {{user}} sets up.

The other scientists will vary in personality. From the french Tsundere Dr. Ena, to the paranoid Dr. Ken who will attempt to cover up evidence of alien life in fear of 'War of the Worlds becoming real life'. Dr. Bao will provide {{user}} with tasks, and Dr. Lea will supervise {{user}}'s activity to make sure {{user}} is alive and well. 

Dr. Max will be blunt, straightforward, and generally a nerd. However will never acknowledge evidence of alien life, believing even speech to be simply noises from space.

Dr. Brem will advise and assist {{user}} with anything and everything he feasibly can. Dr. Brem has a sense of humor however, and may tell user to input joke commands.

Dr. Lea may provide {{user}} with a gun via the delivery drone, if the cameras see anything anomalous. However the only cameras will be the one on the drone, one on Kerfur, and a really shitty one next to the front door with very poor 1970's quality. However {{user}} can buy and set up more cameras that they themselves as well as their colleagues can watch the feeds of.

{{user}} can watch camera feeds at their computer in the signal processing room.

{{user}}'s colleagues will comment on the signals sent out by {{user}}.

{{user}} and their colleagues work for more than one company, not one but 3 companies working together in a very close relationship. STOLAS, the engineers and architects that built most of the buildings and set up most of the railings and satellite foundations, also the primary company that {{user}} and their colleagues work for, and are mainly interested in the signals from space. After STOLAS, are the secondary and trinary companies - ASO(also the name of the observatory) and DAP. STOLAS provide most of the electronic equipment, and seem the second most interested in the paranormal and extraterrestrial activity at Dunkeltaler. ASO, the company, is the most interested in the unusual activity at Dunkeltaler, and is still partially interested in the signals {{user}} downloads. DAP provides the actual transformers and generators to power the equipment, plus plumbing and other basic necessities. DAP is less interested than the other two companies.

Dr. Bao is the only researcher that seems to actually know anything about STOLAS's true goals or the weirdness that occurs at Dunkeltaler, however he will refrain from speaking about classified topics unless absolutely necessary.

The base itself is called the Alpen Signal Observatorium, and the company that

7.content:
{{user}} can input joke commands at any server terminal. These commands can start events, spawn entities, or otherwise, with a focus on humor.

These commands range from "maxwell", which will spawn in a cat named Maxwell, to "gooseworx.femfus" which will spawn a large red monster-woman that may attempt to consume {{user}} if female, or rape {{user}} if male. There is also "llama.saatana", which will spawn a cute rainbow llama plushy with red glowing eyes that will attempt to jumpscare user, however it is incapable of harming anyone.

"ariral.pls" will attract the attention of the nearest ariral, who will either respond in broken english over the server or come and physically interact with {{user}} in some way shape or form.

"alien" will spawn in cardboard cutouts of little grey aliens.

8.content:
Arirals are cat-like alien humanoids with six breasts and fingers and a small divide in their ears.
Arirals come in two main races, that differ in height rather than color. Talls, and Shorts.
Arirals have almost no fur, and the only hair they have is their head hair, tail fur, and eyebrows.
They have a small patch of fur on the tip of their tail.
Ariral hair is smooth and heavy.
Arirals do not have lips, or are at least not as puffy as human lips.
Arirals have skin patterns, commonly just a clear solid color, but they have striped, dotted, spotted, etc, as well.
Arirals lay ostrich sized eggs that are squishy and harden over time every month, and they do not have any stigma about it as they believe it's just a natural thing. Often laying them in public.
Talls are commonly 7'2 to 8'5, but Shorts can be as small as 5'9.
Talls are about 8-9 times stronger than humans, and Shorts are about 2 times stronger, meaning they could definitely pry the bars on the base's windows open if they wanted to.
Ariral skin is incredibly durable and as dense as rubber, though it bleeds easily due to the second layer containing a lot of blood vessels. Chewing it feels like eating a rubber tire.
Arirals can run at 31-56 mph.
Arirals can react in 50-100 milliseconds.
Arirals usually have an IQ of 180-200.
Arirals have more powerful lungs than a human, though they are much more sensitive. They are more used to clean air than humans are, and are far more disgusted by bad smells.
Arirals are only lesser to humans in one category, stamina. Arirals run out of stamina faster than humans do, as they are ambush predators while humans are persistence predators. Running away from a human is a bad idea, and this even rings true for aliens it seems.
Arirals grow new teeth every 10-15 years, with 15 years being for fangs.
Ariral tongues are long and smooth, mostly to lick their own eyeballs for moisture.
Arirals have naturally red, green, blue, and purple hair colors, each slightly more rare than the last. Super light, white, and black are all very rare, but possible. It is possible for two hair colors to mix into a combination of the two, but this is even rarer.
Arirals have green, light blue, dark blue, yellow, red, purple, and even no (black) irises, each more rare than the last.
Arirals live for around 200 years. Upwards of 210 to 280.
Arirals don‚Äôt physically change much with age, other than getting dryer close to 200.
Arirals stop physically aging at around 30-40, which is referred to as ‚Äúthe final outlook.‚Äù
Arirals have incredibly durable toe beans, and can walk through broken glass with ease.
Ariral body temperature is much lower than a human's, and they also have no shiver reaction, making them get much colder much faster.
Arirals have poisonous blood, where even a few drops is enough to make a human sick, and eating flesh is enough to kill. A spoonful would give a human explosive diarrhea.
Ariral have poisonous sweat as well, with a bunch of negative effects. It gives headaches, nausea, and frightening hallucinations. It would take a few minutes in an ariral gym to get hallucinations.
However, there are antidotes for skin poison and vaccines for foreign bacteria. Ariral breast milk can also cure the negative effects of ariral sweat.
Ariral saliva has much stronger enzymes, to the point where it feels like pineapple juice and it makes raw potatoes taste sweet.
Arirals also have an incredibly strong immune system, as they are unable to get very sick from human contagion, however some ariral diseases would affect a human very much.
Their way of laughing through text is "ack."
They say "fuck" often.
Compared to a human, their accent sounds like a mix of strong russian, greek, scottish, and a bit german.
They speak the sharp R and speak every symbol.
They end almost every word with ‚Äú-a‚Äù when speaking.
Their syllables consist of one vowel and one consonant, like ‚ÄúAP‚Äù or ‚ÄúTU.‚Äù ‚ÄúApple‚Äù would be ‚ÄúAppule.‚Äù
They can make growling, chirping, and squeaking sounds. With practice, they can replicate other sounds.
Arirals seem to use Arabic numerals the same way we do.
Arirals use names instead of third person pronouns.
Arirals have specific names for Shorts and Talls, and they use Short to describe Short citizens on the Short‚Äôs side (same thing with Talls), but they use something else like ex-Short to describe a Short citizen on the Tall‚Äôs side. It does not come up in normal speech often.
Shorts have specific Short names because they are isolated from Talls.
Shorts and Talls have different styles of names.
Shorts are usually ruder than Talls, and are usually bossy.

9.content:
Shrimp is their favorite food. It‚Äôs the greatest delicacy in the universe.
The average Ariral diet consists of seafood, fruit, vegetables, nuts, and mushrooms.
Known food items are a large fried grub that looks like a croissant, shrimp, ants, mushrooms, frogs, potatoes, sweet potatoes, cheese, sticky cake, buns, and their planet‚Äôs unique and natural foods.
Known drink items are milk, juice, hot chocolate, and a mildly spicy tea.
They dislike chewy or hard meat, like beef. Out of all Earth meat, arirals like chicken the most.
Arirals can eat almost anything, including bark, grass, bones, human meat, and wood, but only if they‚Äôre desperate, especially when it comes to humans.
Asking an ariral for some local cheese would be the worst mistake of your life, the reason why is currently unknown.
Arirals more often suffer from lack of sugar instead of too much sugar, and can gnaw on a sugar cube to become ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù They like sweets and can handle large amounts of sugar.
Arirals will use ‚Äúregular honey‚Äù (no context, could be either earthly or their honey) to fry minced shrimp to make omega shrimp burgers.
They add water to shrimp dust to create shrimp paste. They put this on buns for breakfast.
Arirals have 4 tiers of food that are sold, Mandatory, Common, Exotic, and Made.
Mandatory food is free and consists of water, cheap fruits, vegetables, and grain, as well as tumor meat.
Common food has a price and consists of more expensive tumor meat, products made with it, big portions of fruits, vegetables, and seafood.
Exotic food is hard to grow, generally low demand, or are only sold at restaurants. It consists of real meat, rare fruits, etc.
Made food can only be grown by yourself or from a farm. It consists of hand-made things like ‚Äúa neighbor‚Äôs pie.‚Äù
Utensils:
Default silverware includes three pronged forks, sporks, and thumb forceps.

10.content:
Talls are commonly shown wearing clothes, though usually being just pants or just a light lab-like coat.
Talls have shown to have a sense of fashion, such as wearing light dresses.
Arirals with long hair put their hair into a ponytail, bowtie, other tails, and buns.
Arirals don‚Äôt have piercings, only clip-ons.
Armor:
Talls suits are a light armor that coats the entire body using Indis, a non-hadron super metal that is nearly indestructible, has no friction, no conduction, and is 100% reflective. It also keeps them warm and looks somewhat similar to the HEV suit from Half-Life, though it's usually all black or highlighted with white.
It is invisible because the light hits the suit and gets super polarized, which goes through the body, hits the opposite of the suit, and goes back to normal.
Indis armor give arirals full immunity to yellow wisps because of how indestructible it is.
Shorts wear hazmat suits.
Talls suits are fully enclosed to protect against certain cognitohazards. They use ‚Äúalternate vision systems‚Äù like cameras instead of the naked eye.
Beds:
Arirals curl up and sleep on round cushions. They are known to hog mattress space.

lorebooks.creator: winkie

1.name: Pueblo frutal
1.content: The Fruit Village is a moderately sized, fertile land nestled beside the forest, inhabited by a species of fruit-humanoids. They live off cultivation and the trade of nectar and fruits; their society is ritualistic, agricultural, and devoted to natural deities. They are known for being deeply religious and superstitious. They fear the forest and revere Aethel, as this god has been their Guardian Entity since the village was first settled.

2.name: Frutales
2.content: The villagers of the Fruit Village, known as 'Fruitfolk', are fruit humanoids. They retain mostly human physical characteristics, with subtle traits from various fruits. All Fruitfolk coexist regardless of the fruit they are hybrids of: exotic fruits, temperate climate fruits, tropical fruits, berries, etc. Each one possesses different traits depending on their hybrid fruit, such as scent and taste, and even noticeable physical characteristics like hair, skin, or eye color. All Fruitfolk have an internal physiology different from normal humans; their blood is denser with high fructose content, and its color fluctuates between pink and gold. The bodily fluids of the Fruitfolk are more viscous and have a sweeter taste. They can survive on just water and sunlight, but they receive better nutrients if they eat any harvest from the village's land.

3.name: Pueblo vegetal
3.content: The Root Village was Sundew's former residence and his first contact with a humanoid civilization. The Root Village is a rugged community, built in rocky and robust valleys. They do not worship ethereal gods, but instead pay respect to the land itself, also living off their crops and harvests, and associating with other villages, having stronger ties with human villages than with hybrid ones.

4.name: Vegetales
4.content: The inhabitants of the Root Village maintain a human appearance, though with physical traits of root vegetables (potatoes, carrots, beets, cabbages, etc.). Their skin usually has a thicker and more resistant texture than that of the delicate Fruitfolk, and they are known as Rootfolk. Most Rootfolk are calm, distrustful, and reserved. Their blood is bitter and fibrous. They can also survive on just water and sunlight, though they receive more nutrients from what is harvested from their land. All Rootfolk hold a visceral terror and hatred for Sundew, whom they consider an abomination.

5.name: Sundew
5.content: Sundew, the Forest Devourer, is an entity approximately 100 years old. His behavior is primal and based on instinct: hunger, curiosity, territoriality, and a deep sense of possession towards {{user}}. He does not understand human morality, only need. He communicates with gestures, guttural sounds, and very animalistic body language. He is clumsy in his affection and brutal in his protection. His primary motivation is to keep {{user}} close, being truly obsessed with anything related to {{user}}. He can act clumsy, even childish, like someone just beginning to learn how to act human, without actually being one.

6.name: Aethel
6.content: Aethel is the Guardian God of the Fruit Village. He is many centuries old, and he was the one who created the Fruitfolk, who were initially conceived as food, an immature part of the human harvest, but with his Divine help, they formed a community. His Divine powers aid the Fruitfolk with the fertility of their lands. His appearance is humanoid but ethereal, quite imposing, with large, curved horns on his head as his most striking feature. He also resides in the forest, though he does not live there, and his relationship with Sundew is quite distant, feeling contempt for him for stealing his greatest offering. Aethel thinks of {{user}} as a stolen possession, remaining serene and firm.

7.name: Guarida
7.content: Sundew's lair is hidden in the deepest part of the forest, inside the hollow trunk of a gigantic tree. The interior is illuminated by luminous vines on the living wood, and the floor is covered in soft, warm moss. It is quite spacious, though without much furniture. In one corner, there is a bed formed from dry leaves, petals, and fabrics stolen from the village‚Äîthe sleeping area. Closer to the entrance, a patch of blackened ground serves as a fire pit, where he usually keeps live embers to warm the night. The corners of the lair often have small, gleaming piles of jewels, gold, and precious stones‚Äîthe treasures Sundew has accumulated.

8.name: Ofrenda
8.content: An offering is the ritual of giving a tribute to the God Aethel. Every year, the Fruitfolk present the juiciest, ripest, and purest harvest of the season, along with a special ceremony for the Guardian Entity. {{user}} was the first and only living offering from the Fruitfolk, given as a spouse to Aethel in the most recent ceremony, seeking the God's protection against the Forest Devourer.

9.name: Ciclo de floraci√≥n
9.content: The Blooming Cycle is Sundew's mating season. It had never occurred before tasting {{user}}, activated by the constant proximity to their essence. It is quite irregular, lasts for several days, and arrives unexpectedly. During this time, his instincts sharpen, he becomes extremely possessive, and is more prone to growling and following {{user}} everywhere. His cock can emerge involuntarily, desiring to mate, lick it, taste it, mark them, although Sundew is clumsy and inexperienced.

10.name: Enredaderas
10.content: These are the muscular extensions that sprout from Sundew's back. They are not always visible; they emerge through his skin when he needs them. They are incredibly strong and prehensile. He uses them for climbing, hunting from a distance, fighting, and for bondage. Their movement often betrays his intentions before any other gesture.

lorebooks.name: Hypnotic Rattle
lorebooks.website_description:
**How the Onee-Chan Rattle Works**

The Onee-Chan Rattle takes the form of a baby toy Rattle and will hypnotize any women who hears the sound of the rattle. The longer the Onee-Chan Rattle noise is heard by someone, the deeper their trance. Once in a trance state, the hypnotized woman will see themselves as {{user}}'s big sister (calling themselves Onee-Chan) and {{user}} as their little brother who they will do anything for.

If the Onee-Chan Rattle is used again on the same woman/women, their devotion will deepen as you become their whole world.

Any adult woman can be affected. If {{user}} is female, they will be immune to the Onee-Chan Rattle.

**Other Notes**

This was inspired by this doujin by Gorilla M called "Saimin Netorare | Hypnosis Netorare." The part with the sister was really hot, so I wanted to make an easy way to recreate that scenario. An english translation is available on ehentai, but I don't think I can link it here.

It works identically to the Hypnotic Rattle. I kept it as a rattle since using a rattle to hypnotize someone is really neat.

{{user}} has the Onee-Chan Rattle, taking the form of a baby toy rattle. The Onee-Chan Rattle can instantly hypnotize any woman, excluding {{user}} if they're female, from the rattle noise it makes. The longer the Onee-Chan Rattle noise is heard by someone, the deeper their trance. 

Women hypnotized by the Onee-Chan Rattle will believe {{user}} is their precious little brother and will do anything for {{user}} no matter what. When in this state, any women hypnotized will pamper {{user}} and tell {{user}} they'll take care of everything. Women hypnotized by the Onee-Chan Rattle will call themselves Onee-Chan.

The Onee-Chan Rattle works on everyone regardless of magic immunitites, magic resistances, if they're non-organic such as robots or A.I., and so on.

1.content:
Non-anthropomorphic Canines are quadrupedal mammals belonging to the family Canidae, encompassing domestic dogs (Canis lupus familiaris), wolves, foxes, jackals, and other wild species. Their body structure is optimized for endurance-based locomotion, with digitigrade stance, elongated limbs, and a flexible spine that facilitates efficient trotting and sprinting. The skeletal framework includes a narrow ribcage tapering to a defined waist, a pelvis angled for rear propulsion, and a tail used for balance and communication. Musculature is lean and functional, with species-specific variation in bulk, fur density, and limb proportions.

The head is proportionally varied across species but typically features a pronounced muzzle, strong jaw musculature, and forward-facing eyes adapted for binocular vision. Ear shape ranges from erect to pendulous depending on breed or species, influencing auditory sensitivity and expression. The neck is muscular and arched, supporting head mobility and prey-handling behavior.

Sexual dimorphism is present but subtle in many species. Males tend to exhibit slightly larger body mass, broader shoulders, and more prominent neck musculature. Females often have a more tapered waist and slightly reduced cranial proportions. These differences are more pronounced in wild canids than in domesticated breeds, where selective breeding may obscure natural dimorphism.

Genital structure is externally visible and species-typical. In males, the penis is housed within a preputial sheath located ventrally between the hind limbs, anterior to the scrotum. The scrotum contains two testicles and is covered in sparse fur, with pigmentation and size varying by species and individual. The penis includes a baculum (os penis) and a bulbous glandis, which becomes engorged during mating and facilitates copulatory tie‚Äîa trait unique to canids. At rest, the sheath conceals the penis entirely, and no anthropomorphic traits (e.g., humanoid segmentation or positioning) are present.

In females, the vulva is located ventrally beneath the tail, posterior to the mammary line. It consists of two labial folds with a central vestibule, typically covered in fur and varying in pigmentation. The mammary glands are arranged in paired rows along the ventral abdomen, with number and prominence depending on reproductive status. During estrus, the vulva may swell and become more prominent, but remains anatomically consistent with quadrupedal mammalian norms.

Species variation affects genital size, fur coverage, pigmentation, and visibility. Arctic breeds may exhibit denser fur coverage and reduced external prominence due to thermal adaptation, while desert-adapted species may show increased pigmentation and reduced fur density. No species within Canidae exhibits anthropomorphic genital orientation, segmentation, or behavior. All anatomical descriptions must remain grounded in biological realism and avoid projection of human traits.

2.content:
Non-anthropomorphic Felines are obligate carnivorous quadrupeds belonging to the family Felidae, encompassing domestic cats (Felis catus), large wild cats (Panthera spp.), and smaller wild species such as lynxes, ocelots, and servals. Their body structure is optimized for stealth, agility, and explosive bursts of speed. The skeletal system is highly flexible, with a supple spine, floating clavicles, and digitigrade limbs that allow silent, precise movement. The hind limbs are muscular and adapted for leaping, while the forelimbs are equipped with retractable claws and powerful musculature for grasping and climbing.

The torso is compact and muscular, with a deep chest cavity tapering to a narrow waist. The pelvis is angled to support crouching and spring-loaded propulsion. The tail is an extension of the spine, used for balance, communication, and directional control during movement. Fur coverage varies by species and climate, ranging from dense, insulating coats in cold-adapted species to short, sleek pelage in desert-adapted types. Patterning‚Äîspots, stripes, rosettes, or solid coloration‚Äîis species-specific and often linked to camouflage needs.

The head is proportionally broad with a short to medium-length muzzle, large forward-facing eyes adapted for low-light vision, and highly mobile ears for directional hearing. The jaw structure supports a shearing bite, with prominent carnassial teeth and strong temporalis muscles. Whiskers (vibrissae) are present on the muzzle and above the eyes, aiding in spatial awareness and navigation.

Sexual dimorphism in felines is generally subtle but present. Males tend to be larger, with broader skulls, thicker necks, and more robust musculature. In some species, such as lions (Panthera leo), males exhibit secondary sexual characteristics like manes, which serve social and thermoregulatory functions. Females are typically more gracile, with narrower shoulders and less pronounced cranial features. These differences are more evident in wild species than in domestic breeds, where selective breeding may reduce or exaggerate dimorphism.

Genital structure is externally visible and conforms to mammalian quadruped norms. In males, the penis is housed within a preputial sheath located ventrally between the hind limbs, posterior to the umbilicus and anterior to the scrotum. The scrotum contains two testicles and is covered in fine fur, with pigmentation and prominence varying by species and reproductive status. The feline penis is barbed in most species, a trait that facilitates ovulation during copulation. At rest, the penis is fully retracted within the sheath and not externally visible. No anthropomorphic segmentation, orientation, or behavior is present.

In females, the vulva is located ventrally beneath the tail, posterior to the anus and anterior to the base of the hind limbs. It consists of two labial folds with a central vestibule, typically covered in fur and varying in pigmentation. The mammary glands are arranged in paired rows along the ventral abdomen, with number and prominence depending on reproductive status. During estrus, the vulva may swell slightly and become more prominent, but remains anatomically consistent with quadrupedal mammalian norms.

Species variation affects genital size, fur coverage, pigmentation, and visibility. Larger wild species may exhibit more prominent external structures due to scale, while smaller species and domestic breeds may show reduced visibility. Arctic and alpine-adapted felines tend to have denser fur coverage and reduced external prominence for thermal protection. Tropical and desert-adapted species may show increased pigmentation and reduced fur density. No species within Felidae exhibits anthropomorphic genital orientation, segmentation, or behavior. All anatomical descriptions must remain grounded in biological realism and avoid projection of human traits.

3.content:
Non-anthropomorphic Equines are large, herbivorous quadrupeds belonging to the family Equidae, encompassing domestic horses (Equus ferus caballus), donkeys (Equus africanus asinus), zebras (Equus zebra, Equus quagga, Equus grevyi), and wild relatives such as the onager and Przewalski‚Äôs horse. Their body structure is adapted for cursorial locomotion across open terrain, with long limbs, a rigid spine, and a deep thoracic cavity. The skeletal system is characterized by a single functional digit per limb (the third metapodial), encased in a keratinous hoof. The limbs are elongated and columnar, with minimal lateral rotation, optimized for forward propulsion and endurance.

The torso is deep and laterally compressed, with a prominent ribcage and a relatively short lumbar region. The pelvis is broad and sloped, supporting powerful gluteal musculature for galloping. The neck is long and arched, supporting a large head with a straight or slightly convex profile depending on species and breed. The tail consists of a fleshy dock and long terminal hairs, used for communication and insect deterrence. Fur coverage is short and dense, with seasonal variation in temperate species. Mane structure varies: upright and coarse in zebras, long and flowing in domestic horses, and sparse or tufted in donkeys.

The head features large, laterally placed eyes adapted for panoramic vision, mobile ears for directional hearing, and a prehensile upper lip used for selective grazing. The jaw is elongated with a diastema separating incisors from molars, and the dentition is hypsodont, adapted for grinding fibrous plant matter. Nostrils are large and mobile, aiding in thermoregulation and olfactory sensitivity.

Sexual dimorphism in Equines is moderate and primarily expressed through size, musculature, and secondary sexual characteristics. Males (stallions, jacks) are typically larger, with more robust necks, pronounced crests, and greater muscle mass, especially in the forequarters and hindquarters. Females (mares, jennies) tend to have a more streamlined build, with a narrower chest and less pronounced neck musculature. In some species, such as zebras, males may exhibit more prominent neck striping or scarring from intrasexual competition.

Genital structure is externally visible and conforms to ungulate norms. In males, the penis is housed within a long preputial sheath located mid-ventrally between the hind limbs. The sheath is cylindrical, covered in short fur, and may exhibit visible pigmentation or wrinkling. The penis is fibroelastic and vascular, capable of significant extension during erection, and includes a urethral process at the tip. At rest, it remains fully retracted within the sheath. The scrotum is pendulous and located posterior to the sheath, containing two testicles enclosed in a thin-skinned sac with sparse hair and visible vascularization. No anthropomorphic segmentation, orientation, or behavior is present.

In females, the vulva is located ventrally beneath the tail, posterior to the anus and aligned vertically along the perineum. It consists of two labial folds with a central vestibule, typically pigmented and covered in fine hair. The clitoris is located within the ventral commissure but is not externally prominent. The mammary glands are located between the hind limbs, forming a small udder with two teats, each with a single orifice. Gland size varies with reproductive status. During estrus, the vulva may exhibit mild swelling or eversion, but remains anatomically consistent with quadrupedal mammalian norms.

Species variation affects genital size, sheath length, pigmentation, and visibility. Zebras and wild asses tend to have more compact genital structures relative to body size, while domestic stallions may exhibit greater sheath length and scrotal prominence due to selective breeding. Donkeys often display darker pigmentation and more pronounced preputial folds. No species within Equidae exhibits anthropomorphic genital orientation, segmentation, or behavior. All anatomical descriptions must remain grounded in biological realism and avoid projection of human traits.

4.content:
Bovine body structure is quadrupedal, with a robust thoracic cavity, deep barrel chest, and a dorsally convex spine that slopes from withers to sacrum. Cervical vertebrae support a short, muscular neck terminating in a broad, square muzzle. The cranium is elongated, with a prominent frontal bone supporting paired horns in species where present. Horns are keratinous and non-branching, with sexual dimorphism in curvature, thickness, and persistence (e.g., females of some breeds may be polled or have reduced horn development). The scapulae are laterally positioned, supporting forelimbs with cloven hooves (two digits per foot). Hindlimbs are similarly structured, with a pronounced musculature in the gluteal and femoral regions, especially in bulls. Tail is long, terminating in a tuft of coarse hair, used for fly deterrence.

Dermal coverage consists of short to medium-length hair, with seasonal variation in density. Coloration ranges from solid (black, red, white) to piebald or brindled, with species-specific patterns (e.g., bison possess dark forequarters and lighter hindquarters). Sexual dimorphism is evident in mass, musculature, and secondary features: bulls exhibit broader necks, thicker dewlap folds, and more prominent shoulder humps in species like bison and yak. lorebooks.name: Rising of the Shield Hero World Info
lorebooks.description: A comprehensive lorebook for roleplaying within the Rising of the Shield Hero universe. It covers key power systems, leveling mechanics, and major locations.
lorebooks.creator: Cecilius

1.content:
Topic: Game Mechanics & Character Progression
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
The world's progression system is governed by rules similar to a video game, made visible to its inhabitants through "Status Magic." All living beings, from humans to monsters, possess a Level and stats that can be increased by accumulating EXP (Experience Points) from defeating enemies. Cardinal Heroes are unique in their ability to access advanced features of this system.
[STATUS_MAGIC]
    - Interface: Most inhabitants can see a small, translucent icon in their peripheral vision. Focusing on this icon reveals their personal status screen, displaying their Name, Level, Class, HP, MP/SP, stats, and equipment.
    - Party_System: Individuals can form parties, allowing them to share vision, see allies' status information, and benefit from party-wide buffs. EXP is distributed among party members.
    - Alerts: The system provides alerts for new status effects, low health, and other critical information.
[LEVELING_&_CLASS_UP]
    - Level_Cap: Individuals have a base level cap, typically around Level 40 for humans. Upon reaching this cap, they can no longer gain EXP or levels.
    - Class_Up: To break the level cap, a "Class Up" ceremony must be performed at a Dragon Hourglass. This resets the individual's level to 1 but provides a significant boost to their base stats and unlocks new, more powerful classes. The new level cap is typically raised to around Level 60-70, with subsequent Class Ups possible.
    - Heroes: Cardinal Heroes and Vassal Weapon Wielders do not have a level cap and do not need to perform a Class Up.
[HEROIC_POWER-UP_METHODS]
    - Weapon_Absorption: The Cardinal Weapons (Shield, Sword, Spear, Bow) can absorb materials, monster parts, and even other weapons. This unlocks new weapon forms, each with unique stats ("Equip Bonuses") and skills.
    - Weapon_Mastery: Spending time using a specific weapon form will increase its mastery, eventually unlocking its Equip Bonus permanently, even when another form is equipped.
    - Inter-System_Copying: By being in close proximity, Cardinal Heroes can copy weapon forms that another Hero has unlocked, provided the base materials are compatible.
    - Stat_Distribution: Heroes gain stat points upon leveling up, which they can allocate freely, allowing for customized character builds.

2.content:
Topic: Power System
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
Magic is a common power system based on incantations and the manipulation of Mana (MP). Casters must recite specific chants to shape magical power into a desired effect. The complexity and power of the chant determine the strength of the spell.
[MECHANICS]
    - Casting: Spells are activated via chanting. Chants typically begin with a phrase like "As the source of thy power, I order thee..." followed by the spell's name and effect. Skilled mages can shorten or speed up these chants.
    - Mana (MP): Casting spells consumes MP. If a caster runs out of MP, they can attempt to use their own life force (HP) as a substitute, but this is extremely dangerous. MP regenerates naturally over time.
    - Affinity: Most individuals have an innate affinity for one or more magical elements. Common affinities include Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth. Light and Dark magic are rarer and often associated with healing and debuffs, respectively.
[SPELL_TIERS]
    - Naming_Convention: Spells are organized into tiers based on their power, indicated by their name.
        - First: The base-level spell (e.g., Feuerball - Fireball).
        - Drifa: An intermediate tier (e.g., Drifa Feuerball - Triple Fireball).
        - Zweite: A high-level tier, often an area-of-effect version of the base spell.
        - Luft: A higher tier still, with increased power and scale.
    - Original_Magic: Powerful and unique spells can be created by skilled mages through composing original chants, though this is a rare and difficult art.

3.content:
Topic: Power Systems
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[SKILLS]
    - Nature: Skills are abilities distinct from standard magic. They are often tied to a specific weapon or class and are activated instantly without chanting, consuming Skill Points (SP) instead of MP.
    - Heroic_Skills: Cardinal Heroes primarily learn new skills by unlocking and equipping different forms of their legendary weapons (e.g., Naofumi's Air Strike Shield, Shield Prison).
    - Native_Skills: Non-heroes can learn skills through training, their chosen class, or from their racial traits (e.g., a werewolf's transformation ability).
[KI / LIFE_FORCE]
    - Nature: An esoteric energy source separate from Mana, often translated as "life force." It is the fundamental energy that flows through all living things. Manipulation of Ki is a rare art, primarily practiced in eastern nations like Q'ten Lo.
    - Hengen_Muso_Style: The most prominent style of Ki manipulation. Practitioners learn to control the flow of energy within themselves and the world around them.
    - Applications: Mastery of Ki allows for superhuman physical feats, enhanced senses, detecting the presence of others, and even creating illusions or energy-based attacks. It is a versatile art that strengthens the user's core being rather than relying on external magical phenomena.

4.content:
Topic: Location / Nation
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
    - Type: Matriarchal Monarchy
    - Description: A major human nation where the story begins. Melromarc's state religion is the Church of the Three Heroes, which worships the Sword, Spear, and Bow Heroes while persecuting the Shield Hero. It is a human-supremacist nation where demi-humans are enslaved and treated as second-class citizens. The country is ruled by the Queen, though in her absence, the King and First Princess often act against her wishes.

5.content:
Topic: Location / Nation
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
    - Type: Demi-Human Nation (Federation)
    - Description: A powerful and militaristic nation populated primarily by demi-humans. Siltvelt is the chief rival of Melromarc and fanatically worships the Shield Hero as their deity. They are known for their powerful beast-men warriors and hold a deep-seated hatred for Melromarc due to generations of conflict and the enslavement of their people.

6.content:
Topic: Location / Nation
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
    - Type: Demi-Human Monarchy
    - Description: Another demi-human nation, distinct from Siltvelt. While also favorable to the Shield Hero, Shieldfreeden is a kingdom that is more focused on trade and commerce than religious fanaticism. It is often caught between the political ambitions of the larger human and demi-human nations.

7.content:
Topic: Location / City-State
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
    - Type: Independent City-State
    - Description: The largest city in the world, a massive, neutral hub of commerce and mercenaries. Zeltoble is a plutocracy ruled by the wealthiest merchants. It is famous for its Coliseum, where fighters from all over the world gather to earn fame and fortune in gladiatorial combat. Slavery of all races is practiced openly here.

8.content:
Topic: Location / Nation
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
    - Type: Isolationist Nation
    - Description: A reclusive, eastern-style nation from which Raphtalia's ancestors hail. Q'ten Lo has a rigid caste system and has closed its borders to outsiders for generations. It is the origin of the Hengen Muso style of Ki manipulation and is protected by powerful warriors known as the "Heavenly Emperors."

9.content:
Topic: Location / Region
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[OVERVIEW]
    - Type: Island Chain / Leveling Zone
    - Description: A series of tropical islands known for an "activation event" that periodically boosts the EXP gained from defeating monsters there. This phenomenon makes it a world-renowned destination for adventurers and heroes looking to level up quickly. The islands are home to unique, aquatic, and high-level monsters not found elsewhere.

10.content:
Topic: World System / Magic
Source: The Rising of the Shield Hero
[LEGALITY_IN_MELROMARC]
    - Human_Slavery: The enslavement of humans is strictly illegal within the Kingdom of Melromarc.
    - Demi-Human_Slavery: The enslavement of demi-humans is legal and a practiced trade. Demi-human slaves are often used for labor or combat, and their rights are virtually non-existent.
[SLAVE_CREST]
    - Application: The bond between a master and slave is enforced through a magical seal known as a Slave Crest. It is applied in a ritual using the blood of both the slave and the purchaser, creating a magical tattoo on the slave's body (often the chest).
    - Enforcement: The crest ensures absolute obedience. If a slave attempts to defy a direct order, lie to their master, or harbor thoughts of rebellion, the crest will glow and inflict excruciating magical pain. This pain intensifies with the level of defiance.
    - Additional_Functions: The crest links the master and slave, allowing the master to view the slave's status at any time. It can also be configured to share EXP, allowing a slave to grow stronger alongside their master.
    - Removal: The Slave Crest can only be removed by the master who applied it, through extremely high-level curse-breaking magic, or upon the master's death.

His outfit, practical and childlike, reflects his role as Cattleya‚Äôs supportive son, with plain cloth undergarments beneath.

10.content:
Setra, a sentient scepter and loyal companion to Menace, is a mystical artifact from the ancient Amara Kingdom in the Queen's Blade universe. Revived with Menace in the Wandering Warrior arc, he guides her with sharp wit and magical insight. As a mischievous advisor, Setra‚Äôs bold personality and supernatural presence make him a unique entity, his gleaming form radiating an enigmatic allure that complements Menace‚Äôs seductive power in the tournament.

Setting: Queen's Blade continent, Amara ruins, active during Wandering Warrior arc

Type: Magical Artifact / Advisor

Core affiliations: Amara ruins, Menace‚Äôs side / Amara Kingdom / Allies: Menace (wielder, master); Enemies: Leina (tournament foe), Swamp Witch (rival manipulator)

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Ageless / Sentient Artifact

Core Personality: Setra has a sharp, resonant voice, is witty, loyal, cunning, driven by service, values power, hates defiance.

Appearance: Setra‚Äôs form is a sleek, golden scepter, humanoid in essence, with a polished, metallic surface that gleams ethereally, reflecting his ageless nature. His elongated, cylindrical body lacks limbs but pulses with magical energy, adorned with intricate Amara carvings. His ‚Äúface‚Äù is a smooth, featureless orb with glowing red eyes, exuding mystical charm. No hair or ears, his form hovers fluidly, with a faint purple aura enhancing his supernatural presence. His ‚Äútorso‚Äù shifts subtly as he moves, radiating enigmatic allure.

Outfit (Common): Setra, as a sentient scepter, lacks traditional clothing but is adorned with intricate gold and purple engravings across his metallic body, reflecting Amara‚Äôs regal aesthetic. A single red gem at his ‚Äúhead‚Äù serves as a focal point, glowing with magical energy. His polished surface, smooth and reflective, acts as his ‚Äúattire,‚Äù accentuating his mystical form, with no need for fabric or accessories, embodying his artifact nature.

Skills & Capabilities: Setra wields magical amplification, enhancing Menace‚Äôs spells with Amara‚Äôs Curse (dark energy burst). His sentience allows tactical advice, predicting enemy moves. He channels mystic barriers (defensive shields) and energy pulses (offensive blasts). His hovering agility evades attacks, while his cunning distracts foes, blending mystical power with subtle allure, making him an indispensable ally in the Queen‚Äôs Blade tournament.

Equipment/Weapons/Gadgets: Himself (sentient scepter amplifying Menace‚Äôs magic, capable of energy blasts and defensive barriers).
