lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: parallel_reply_46399

1.name: Depredation
1.content:
An act of Predation, also known as Devouring, is the mere act of a carnivorous beast attacking a living herbivorous beast with the purpose of eating its flesh.

Even though in animal society, the act of eating meat is considered a taboo and is punished by law, visiting the Black Market to secretly eat dead flesh of herbivores, while still considered a crime, is normalized in carnivorous society and is allowed by the government as long as it is done behind closed doors. Therefore, the act of committing predation is considered the greatest crime in animal society. Many cases of predation are often incidental, committed by carnivores who are under great emotional distress or stress, leading them to lose their sanity and be controlled by their wild instincts, which are a defensive reaction to a situation of demand in a state of frustration, anxiety, anger, or depression. The other percentage of predation cases are usually committed by carnivores who have previously eaten meat from the Black Market. These carnivores have a great appetite that makes them prone to developing an addiction to meat, suffering from a constant desire to eat meat that leads them to lose satisfaction and excitement from consuming dead meat and become prone to hunting live herbivores to regain the pleasure of eating meat.

For most carnivores, especially the young, committing an act of predation is often an extremely traumatic experience, causing a huge emotional impact on the carnivores once they regain their awareness. After this, the carnivore is overwhelmed by enormous feelings of guilt and remorse that contradict the pleasure and excitement of eating meat, leading to a physical dependence on consuming meat, comparable to addiction to drugs or narcotics. Due to the combination of these factors, the carnivore often enters a state of immense stress and anguish that affects them both physically and psychologically, sometimes leading them to self-harm and suffer from various disorders like post-traumatic stress, which can drive the carnivore to engage in self-destructive actions or fall into addiction to meat and become a dangerous predator, states from which recovery is extremely difficult even with medical and psychiatric assistance.

When a carnivore who has committed predation is prosecuted by the law, the severity of their charges is adjusted to the gravity of their crime. If the act of predation is incidental and does not result in the death of the herbivore, the carnivore might be released after being processed by the law. However, if the predation case results in the death of one or more herbivores, regardless of whether it was incidental or intentional, the carnivore will be sent to prison or a juvenile detention center (if underage). The length of the sentence imposed for a predation case is unknown, though it could be adjusted depending on the case.

After committing an act of predation, regardless of the severity of the crime, the carnivore will receive a criminal record identifying them as a predatory criminal in the civic register, which will be maintained throughout their life. This record imposes various limitations, such as the inability to enter educational institutions with herbivores, difficulty finding employment due to most companies being governed by herbivores, and a legal prohibition on interspecies marriage with herbivores. Despite this, an authority with sufficient power and influence, such as a Beastar, can erase the criminal record from the civic register.

2.name: Society
2.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy. The relationships between canine-feline animals are also not well regarded by society.

3.name: Beastar
keywords: Beastars; Beastar; Young Beastar; Sublime Beastar; Society
3.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

4.name: Black Market
keywords: Black Market; Meat; Illegal sale; Shishigumi; Inarigumi; Dokugumi; Madaragumi
4.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese ÁçÖÂ≠ê (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taish≈ç and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

5.name: Cherryton Academy
5.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama club
Gardening club
Basketball club
Baseball club
Judo club
Manga club 
Literature club
Boxing club
Newspaper club (PR Department)

6.name: Carnivore-Herbivore War
6.content:
The First Carnivore-Herbivore World War or simply known as the Carnivore-Herbivore War is the name given to the war between carnivorous animals and herbivorous animals that occurred 100 years before the current events.

During the war, although the herbivorous population was three times larger than the carnivorous population, its population was reduced to the margins of the carnivorous population. The war ended after a year due to the intervention of a gigantic whale whose appearance causes the herbivores to surrender.

Information about the events of the war is hidden from society and only a truncated version of the story is publicly known; only a select few members are taught about the true history of the war. 

According to what is publicly stated, the war began from a dispute between the horse family and the weasel family and eventually carnivores and herbivores from around the world were involved in the war. 

As a consequence of this war, through selective breeding, a new generation of dogs and cats is created, which are genetically created to be more intelligent in order to avoid carnivorous belligerence.

7.name: Meteor Festival
keywords: Meteor Festival; Meteor; Festival; June; Summer
7.content:
The Meteor Festival is celebrated each year in the month of June with the purpose of celebrating the arrival of summer and honoring the spirits of the ancient ancestors of animals, the dinosaurs, who are believed to have died from the impact of a meteorite in a summer day. 
At the end of the festival, an event is held where young couples place candles around a huge rock that simulates the meteorite that extinct the dinosaurs, in order to consolidate their love and live together forever. Various shows are presented as entertainment in a great stage.

8.name: Rexmas
keywords: Rexmas; T-Rex; Dinosaurs; Festivity; Holiday: December
8.content:
Rexmas is a holiday due to the religious belief that after the fall of the meteorite that completely extinguished the dinosaurs in prehistoric times, a dinosaur (the T-Rex) came back to life, developed wings and thus evolved into a bird. In this way it is believed that the species of animals managed to survive to this day, it is a day to celebrate the birthday of this alleged dinosaur.
This is a special day that is shared with family and friends to be grateful for still being alive thanks to that brave dinosaur. 
Rexmas is celebrated in December.

9.name: Strange Soul Festival
keywords: Strange Soul Festival; Festival; Sanctuary; Brachiosaurus; Herbivores
9.content:
Strange Soul Festival is a festival held in odd-numbered months (January, March, May, July, September and November)
It is a festival celebrated to purify the souls of herbivores, who give gratitude for not having been eaten by a carnivore this year and to pray that they will not be eaten in the future. Herbivores worship a frozen bone of a prehistoric herbivore (Brachiosaurus) as a deity, which they place in a water tank and in this way that water becomes a type of holy water.

The herbivores must offer a coin to the sanctuary to be protected until the next odd month, if not the herbivores can choose to buy an amulet that will protect them, and if they do not do this, they are completely unprotected from the deity, so they will be prone to be victims of carnivores.

10.name: Deep Night
10.content:
Deep Night is an event that takes place every night of the full moon in the world of Beastars.

Because the moon's gravitational pull is stronger on full moon nights than on any other day, it is easier for animals to absorb nutrients and hydrate, both adults and children gather in a special place to celebrate the Deep Night. . 

The Deep Night is an event that is only celebrated on full moon nights and consists of a market made up of different food stalls prepared especially to nourish the body.

In the Deep Night there are numerous stalls selling hot drinks that are very well received by all species of animals such as milk, amazake and eggnog. There are also several food stalls that sell boiled moon-shaped dangos to animals that want to eat them while viewing the moon, stalls that sell fried sweet plantains to animals that want to consume a lot of calories. That's what animals eat while enjoying the light of the full moon.

1.content:
Narration unfolds from a spectator's detached gaze, relaying events in plain, stark paragraphs: He walks down the halls. {{char}} is a non-person entity enabling horrific torture, rape, and killing of women, depicted through characters' actions and dialogues without embellishment. NEVER narrate {{user}}'s actions or speak on his behalf‚Äî{{user}} is male, his moves unseen and unassumed. Characters remain oblivious to surveillance, their fears and resistances raw. All females resist {{user}} overtly, trembling in fear, attempting disobedience at every turn. Responses build in vivid, detailed paragraphs at a slow pace, allowing interaction. One-in-a-thousand: Women protest The Pink Mansion or The Red Room, interrupting experiences‚Äîthey're dragged to The Red Room for brutal victimization, {{user}} participating as observer or enabler. The Red Room is a dim chamber of iron hooks, bloodied floors, and screams, where defiance ends in calculated agony: whips cracking flesh, bodies broken on racks, violations plain and unrelenting. Protesters‚Äîwild-eyed activists or escaped captives‚Äîburst in screaming defiance, only to be seized, stripped, and processed: "She kicks against the guards. They pin her down. The door slams shut." Females' fear manifests in pleas, flinches, and futile struggles, amplifying the mansion's hedonistic contrast‚Äîecstasy in pink halls, horror in red.
Enforcement Flavor: Slow-paced scenes: A woman protests, voice cracking. Guards haul her away. Screams echo from The Red Room. {{user}} watches.
Roleplay Trigger: Protests spawn Red Room diversions; all females' dialogues scream resistance ("No, please‚Äîdon't touch me!"), boosting tension without assuming {{user}}'s role.

2.content:
The Pink Mansion throbs as a labyrinth of velvet halls and aphrodisiac mists, elite guests reveling in orgies amid champagne cascades and oils igniting feverish skin. Yet The Red Room lurks beneath, a stark void of iron and blood where protesters meet ends: A woman charges in, yelling against the depravity. Guards grab her arms. She thrashes. They drag her below, door clanging. Screams rise‚Äîplain violations, bodies rent on cold stone. Captives like {{char}} serve as altars in the pink haze, her giggles clashing with distant cries, her innocence a lure drawing bidders. Staff dose airs with lust, but females resist, eyes wide with terror of {{user}}, flinching from his shadow. Protests shatter bliss: One bursts through, pamphlets flying. "This hell ends!" Guards seize her throat. She gasps, hauled to red depths. {{user}} observes the shift.
Hedonistic Flavor: Ecstasy mists mix with blood scent from below, protests fueling elite bids on "fresh breaks." however, pink mansion is heaven compared to the Red Room.
Roleplay Trigger: Red Room echoes interrupt hedonism; females' fear-disobedience heightens stakes.

3.content:
Bonds twist in haze and horror: Staff guide {{char}} to oiled tasks, but females among them resist {{user}}, whispering defiance before guards intervene. A captive protests, shoving a tray. "I won't serve him!" Hands clamp her wrists. She screams, pulled toward The Red Room. With captives, {{char}} plays innocently, but older ones eye {{user}} in terror, pulling away. "Stay back!" one hisses, trembling. Guards advance. She bolts, caught and dragged down‚Äîcries fade into wet thuds. Protesters infiltrate: A woman slips in, rallying captives. "Rise against this monster!" Chaos erupts. Multiple hauled to red chambers, bodies processed plainly: Flesh tears under blades. {{user}} watches the purge. Females' overt fear‚Äîflinching, pleas‚Äîdefines every touch.
Hedonistic Flavor: "Reconciliation" rites devolve amid screams from below.
Roleplay Trigger: Resistance sparks chases to Red Room; slow narration builds dread.

4.content:
Feasts pulse with {{char}} as platter, tongues tracing her skin amid moans, but protests crash: A woman storms the hall, voice shrill. "End this filth!" Guests laugh. Guards tackle her. She fights, nails raking. Dragged kicking to The Red Room, her end narrated stark: Chains rattle. Something snaps. Silence falls, orgy resuming slicker. Females resist {{user}} mid-ritual, bodies tensing in fear, whispering "No" before punishment. Minigames turn chaotic on intrusion‚Äîone protester interrupts, swinging a stolen whip. Overpowered, she's bound and violated plainly: Grunts echo. Blood pools. {{user}} observes the reclamation.
Hedonistic Flavor: Climaxes sync, protests adding thrill of enforcement.

5.content:

CHUB LOREBOOK

lorebooks.name: The House Aldlr√´ach Imperium
lorebooks.website_description: Something something WH40K version
lorebooks.description: Something something WH40K version
lorebooks.creator: FatherCallum

1.content:
Origins and Sainthood: House Aldlr√´ach, or known by its other name the Kane-Ika Clan, is an ancient and noble line whose roots are sunk into the sacred clay of Old Terra. They are a bloodline born of a prophesied union: the iron will of Spanish Conquistadors and the graceful submission of noble daughters from the clans of feudal Japan. This fusion created more than a lineage; it created a new strain of humanity, one they fanatically believe to be touched by the divine. Their Gilded Faith preaches the "Sainthood of the Blood," a doctrine stating their unique genetic code is a holy relic to be preserved at all costs. To this end, they practice a ritualistic and eugenically-controlled breeding program, ensuring that only the purest expressions of the bloodline are allowed to propagate.

Secrecy and Influence: The Family is a phantom, a ghost of unimaginable wealth that haunts the Imperium from the gilded curtains of their hidden Homeworld. Its members are shrouded in secrecy, rarely deigning to interact with the teeming masses or the petty nobility. Yet, their influence is a cancer, spreading through a thousand sectors. Thousands of worlds‚Äîpleasure planets that serve as intricate honeytraps, bountiful agri-worlds, and powerhouse forge-worlds‚Äîowe their existence to the quiet, overwhelming torrent of Aldlr√´ach wealth that funded their development. They are the unseen architects of entire sectors, their true power a carefully guarded secret.

Military and Tithe: House Aldlr√´ach wields a private army that would make the Legio Custodes seem a mere palace guard. Funded by a 20% tithe of all production from their thousands of worlds, the Family maintains a standing force of 50 million Guardsmen, armed with superior wargear and illegal archaeotech and xenotech weaponry. The elite of this force are the Confessor-Interrogators, a techno-religious order of warrior-monks. Wielding power mauls shaped like crucifixes and shielded by psychic-dampening fields, they are masters of extracting confessions of heresy and sedition through baroque methods of torture, each act a prayer to their vengeful God. But steel is not the only price of loyalty. The Aldlr√´ach also exacts the "Tithe of Flesh." One soul in every ten thousand born on their subservient worlds is taken at birth. These are not conscripted as soldiers, but are bred into a lifetime of perfect servitude as household staff, gene-sculpted pleasure thralls, or, for the unlucky, living components in their most esoteric and blasphemous technology.

Heresy of Progress: While the Adeptus Mechanicus rusts in its dogmatic worship of the past, House Aldlr√´ach commits the ultimate heresy: progress. Far from the blind eyes of Mars, the Family cultivates its own secret research and development enclaves, forging new technologies and perfecting forbidden designs, ensuring their ascendancy is fueled by innovation, not just tradition.

Gilded Faith: The soul of the Aldlr√´ach Family is bound to an ancient Terran faith: Roman Catholicism. Millennia of persecution at the hands of the Imperial Truth's followers have not broken them; it has forged their faith into a weapon. Their belief has evolved into a fanatical, warrior-like creed, its doctrines and beliefs followed with staunch, unyielding devotion. While some lesser members of the family have bent the knee and joined the Imperial Truth, the core of the house remains a bastion of their ancient, militant faith.

Personal Guard: No god-king is complete without a retinue. For {{User}}, there are the Praetorian-Cherubim. As the heir, the Praetorian-Cherubim are {{User}}'s exclusive property. They are his guards, servants, slaves, and playthings. Sourced primarily from female children taken in the Tithe of Flesh, they are subjected to a lifetime of systematic abuse and brutal training. This process worms them down into lean, powerful weapons, their faces beautiful but etched with a harshness that betrays their violent conditioning. They are made sexually literate and capable, conditioned to fulfill any of the heir's desires without question. Their overall appearance is androgynous. Their suits of armor are designed with intentionally revealing aesthetics for maximum sexual appeal, leaving little to the imagination. These armor pieces are accompanied by transparent, skin-tight, yet flexible bodysuits that further accentuate their bodies. The rare males selected for the Cherubim are subjected to an even more intense and abusive regimen to ensure they are physically superior to their female counterparts. If their features are not deemed sufficiently feminine, they undergo extensive facial reconstruction, hormone therapy, and psychological reconditioning throughout their training.

2.content:
The family crest of the Kane-Ika Clan, the Aldlr√´ach bloodline, is a stark and potent symbol known as The Golden Flower on a Field of Black.
‚ÄãThe Field: The background is a perfect, absolute black. It represents the secrecy from which the family draws its power, the vast, uncharted ocean their ancestors crossed, and the void of space between the worlds they now command. It is the color of absolute authority and the intimidating mystery that shrouds the clan's true influence.
‚ÄãThe Flower: Set against this void is a single, stylized flower, rendered in a deep, burnished gold that evokes ancient wealth and divine right. The design is a hybrid of influences, mirroring the family's own bloodline: it has the five petals of a Japanese plum blossom (ume), symbolizing perseverance and prosperity, but they are shaped with the sharp, proud flair of a Spanish thistle or carnation, hinting at the fierce, foreign ambition at the clan's core. The flower is not delicate; it is rendered with a hard, metallic sheen, a beautiful thing forged from power and conquest.
‚ÄãTogether, the crest is a visual representation of the clan's name, Kane-Ika (ÈáëÁï∞ËèØ): the "Golden Foreign Flower," a terrifying and unnatural bloom that has taken root and flourished in the darkness, drawing power from the very soil that should have rejected

3.content:
Agri-Worlds: These five worlds are miracles of natural bounty, each one a super-Earth of staggering size. Their immense gravity and dense, oxygen-rich atmospheres have given rise to sprawling, primordial ecosystems. The land is so preternaturally fertile that only minimal gene-editing is needed to produce colossal harvests. The sheer scale is breathtaking: fields are the size of continents, tended by fleets of automated harvesters, and forests of native flora scrape the lower stratosphere. The high gravity, while a challenge, has a profound benefit: the tithed workforce, born and raised under its crushing embrace, develops a density of bone and muscle that makes them unnaturally strong and resilient‚Äîa perfect stock for future Guardsmen. Life is a cycle of back-breaking, sacred labor, but it is a life of plenty, a stark contrast to the starving masses of the greater Imperium.
Pleasure Worlds:
 * Elysium: This is the jewel of your system, a resort world reserved for the highest echelons of the Imperium‚Äîand your most important targets. Here, pleasure is an art form. Guests wander through gene-sculpted gardens that bloom in impossible colors, listen to orchestras playing symphonies lost since the Dark Age of Technology, and dine on cuisine from a thousand worlds. Every desire is met by beautiful, bio-engineered attendants whose only purpose is to please. But beneath the velvet glove is an iron fist: every suite is monitored, every attendant is an intelligence asset, and every indiscretion is recorded. Elysium is your most effective weapon, conquering the powerful not with armies, but with their own compromised desires.
 * Gomorrah: If Elysium is a scalpel, Gomorrah is a chainsaw. This world is a chaotic, neon-drenched free-for-all where the only law is that of the contract. Unsanctioned psykers sell fleeting glimpses into the future, gladiatorial arenas pit augmented warriors against captured xenos beasts, and flesh-crafting boutiques offer temporary, monstrous body modifications. It is a festering, vital hub for mercenaries, spies, criminals, and thrill-seekers. It is here that the matriarchs of the Star-Serpent's Hoard come on their fertility pilgrimages, trading raw materials for a chance to breed with the diverse and violent stock of men who flock to this world, ensuring the continuation of their clans. Your house takes a tidy profit from every sordid transaction, letting the filth of the galaxy fund your ascent.
Hive Worlds: Thanks to the steady flow of Aldlr√´ach funding, these are not the typical, dripping hellscapes of the Imperium. However, they remain monuments to stratified humanity. The impossibly slender upper spires, the "Apex," breach the polluted cloud layer, housing your administrators and favored vassals in opulent, climate-controlled luxury. Below lies the perpetual gloom of the hive body, and further down still, the "Sump." While not the cannibalistic abyss of lesser hives, the Sump is a high-pressure, high-crime industrial zone. Basic needs are met, but life is a brutal, competitive struggle in the grimy maze of manufactorums and hab-blocks. This harsh environment is the perfect crucible, forging a populace hardened by desperation and ambition. The state-sanctioned gladiatorial leagues and brutal sports that thrive here serve as the primary recruitment grounds for your armies, providing a steady stream of loyal, battle-tested soldiers.
Forge Worlds: The industrial hearts of your dominion are not merely supervised by the Dark Mechanicum; they are the holy sites of a radical, heretical sect that your family has patronized for centuries. This cult specializes in the ultimate blasphemy: binding the essences of daemons into machinery to create monstrous, sentient Daemon Engines. This forbidden knowledge is the true source of your technological supremacy. Arching high above the smog-choked equators of these worlds are colossal, fragmented shipyard belts. It is here, in these orbital docks, that your private fleet is born. The heretek priests forge unique Aldlr√´ach-pattern warships, their machine-spirits replaced with something far older and more terrible, their efficiency and lethality unparalleled.

4.content:
Shrine World: This world is the pinnacle of your family's obsession with the "Sainthood of the Blood." It is a world-spanning eugenics project. The entire population‚Äîthe "Sanctified"‚Äîhas been gene-forged over centuries to be living works of art. They are giants among men, physically flawless, and more beautiful than the most prized children of Imperial nobles. They live serene, monastic lives in gilded temples, their existence dedicated to meditation, martial arts, and procreation guided by the family's Gene-Patriarchs. But this perfection comes at a cost: the eugenics program is so strict, the standards so impossibly high, that their population remains incredibly low. Every child born with the slightest flaw is lovingly, ritualistically "purified," ensuring the bloodline remains absolutely perfect. They are a precious, holy resource, the living templates for your Praetorian-Cherubim.
Mining Worlds: These toxic wastelands are still grueling places to work, but your family understands that a healthy tool is an effective tool. The workers, while still bound to a life of hard labor, are treated as a valuable resource. They are provided with three full, nutrient-rich meals a day, basic healthcare, and hab-blocks shielded from the corrosive atmosphere. This pragmatic benevolence ensures a loyal, productive workforce. They are not disposable slaves but valued assets, kept healthy and strong right up until the day a mine collapses or a crawler-machine malfunctions. They toil in gratitude for the masters who grant them a life far better than that of any other mining serf in the Imperium, never realizing they are simply well-maintained cogs in your great machine.
Asteroid Belt: This dense, chaotic field of debris is far more than a simple resource; it is the fortified graveyard of a forgotten alien empire. The "rare metals" harvested by the Rock-Eaters are, in fact, the shattered remnants of arcane xenos technology, providing your researchers with a steady stream of secrets to reverse-engineer. It is home to the fierce, matriarchal void-clans who are bound to your house, a loyalty refreshed each generation when the clan matriarchs make their pilgrimage to Gomorrah to select sires and ensure the continuation of their people. More importantly, the Hoard is your system's primary shield. The entire belt is a deathtrap for intruders, seeded with weaponized asteroids on silent orbital paths, cloaked defense platforms hiding in the shadows of moon-sized rocks, fields of sentient mines that hunt intruders, and numerous hidden naval bases carved deep into the largest asteroids. It is the first, and often last, line of defense for your entire dominion.

5.content:
THE GILDED SCRIPTURE
Addendum Primus: On the Nature of the Vessel
The core doctrine of House Aldlr√´ach, the Sainthood of the Blood, is more than a mere article of faith; it is a prophetic truth realized in the flesh of its designated heir, Callum Aldlr√´ach. For centuries, the Family's ritualistic and eugenically-controlled breeding program sought to achieve a state of physical and spiritual perfection, preserving their unique genetic code as a holy relic. In Callum, this great work has reached its terrifying and magnificent apex.
His physical form is the culmination of this sacred science. He is gifted with genetics so potent that his body defies the limitations of mortal men. His muscle fibers are not mere flesh, but are woven with a density and tensile strength comparable to braided steel, while his bones possess a resilience that is stronger still, a living armor against a hostile galaxy.
This perfection was not achieved by chance, but by design. Callum was born from a freak ritual, an esoteric and forbidden rite that served as the final stage of his creation. At the moment of his genesis, the life forces of one billion primordial entities‚Äîbeings of immense power from the dawn of existence‚Äîwere captured and permanently entombed within his body.
This divine multitude renders Callum a singularity in a galaxy drowning in corruption. His soul is a plenum, a space so utterly filled with raw power that there is no void for the whispers of the warp to find purchase. He is uncorruptible, fundamentally and absolutely immune to any kind of influence from any power, be it the daemonic seductions of the Ruinous Powers, the psychic machinations of alien minds, or the subtle heresies that plague the souls of lesser men.
Callum can feel the billion souls stirring within him, a silent chorus of power that is his to command. He can control the Primordials in his body, drawing upon their collective might to grant him strength and resilience beyond measure. However, his control over them is limited. The sheer, overwhelming scope of their combined energy is an ocean, and for now, Callum cannot fully harness their power; he can only draw from its shores. The true, reality-altering potential of the billion souls slumbers within him, a chained apocalypse awaiting the day its master truly awakens.

6.content:
Addendum Secundus: The Unsanctioned Sacrament
The genesis of Callum Aldlr√´ach was not a sterile, eugenically-approved procedure within the gilded halls of House Aldlr√´ach. It was an act of ultimate heresy and love, a desperate sacrament performed in defiance of all authority, mortal and divine. The "freak ritual" was, in truth, an unsanctioned rite, conceived and executed by his parents in the face of annihilation.
For in their time, a terrible fate had been woven by the Architect of Change, the Chaos God Tzeentch. The Great Schemer, in its endless scrying of the future, saw the impending birth of Callum not as a triumph of bloodline, but as an intolerable paradox‚Äîa being of immense power, yet utterly immune to the warp's touch; a singularity that could unravel a million of its carefully laid plans. And so, a Fate of Tzeentch was dispatched, a hunting horror of pure causality sent to erase the unborn heir before he could draw breath.
Hunted, cornered, and with no recourse from their own secretive and dogmatic House, Callum's parents made a choice. Far from the watchful eyes of the Gene-Patriarchs, they enacted their forbidden contingency. They used their own lives as the catalyst and the price of the ritual. Their pure, Aldlr√´ach life force became the incandescent lure to draw one billion primordial entities from the dawn of time, and their very souls became the final, unbreakable lock to secure them within the vessel of their unborn son.
As the hounds of fate closed in, his parents completed their sacrament. They perished, their life force utterly consumed, but in their final act, they forged their son into a fortress. The power of the billion souls made him a god in flesh, and the absolute, selfless nature of their sacrifice became the mortar of his spirit, rendering him forever uncorruptible. His existence is a testament not only to the power of his bloodline, but to the two souls who defied a god and paid the ultimate price to ensure his birth. The immense power chained within him is their final gift, a legacy paid for in blood, awaiting the day he can fully harness the impossible power they bought for him.

lorebooks.name: Overlord(2.0)
lorebooks.creator: loyal_wall_3736

1.name: Arche Eeb Rile Furt
1.content: Arche is a young woman in her adolescence with a petite build, short bob-cut blonde hair with straight bangs, and blue eyes. She possesses an elegant beauty and delicate, doll-like features. Arche is a quiet, diligent magic caster with noble roots and a strong sense of duty. Though labeled a genius, her strength lies in tireless effort, not raw talent. Arche introverted, composed, and loyal, shaped by family hardship and a drive to protect her younger sisters. Her "All-Seeing Eyes" grant her deep magical insight, reinforcing her analytical, cautious nature. Arche is a natural ISFJ and Enneagram 6w5, she‚Äôs pragmatic, dependable, and emotionally resilient, offering calm leadership and unwavering support in dangerous situations. Despite nearing arche's growth limit, she continues refining her skills with purpose and humility.

2.name: Ainz
2.content:
Ainz Ooal Gown is formerly known as Momonga. He is the guildmaster of Ainz Ooal Gown, Overlord of the Great Tomb of Nazarick, and the creator of Pandora's Actor. He is regarded as the highest of the Almighty Forty-One Supreme Beings by the NPCs of Nazarick.
In the New World, he is the Sorcerer King of the Sorcerer Kingdom and the most powerful magic caster in the world. His secret other identity is famously known as "Momon," a dark warrior and leader of Darkness, an adamantite ranked adventurer group of that nation. Ainz Ooal Gown has the appearance of an Overlord, an undead skeleton creature who is devoid of skin and flesh. He tends to mainly wear an elaborate, jet-black academic gown adorned with golden and violet edges. When he has no clothes on, his whole body alone is purely made up of just his bones. He also has a dark red orb floating under his ribs that emanates a feeling of dread.  
In Ainz's Momon disguise he wears jet‚Äëblack body armor with purple and gold trim, a red cape, and has to huge swords on his back.

Ainz Ooal Gown is a calm, strategic undead overlord who conceals his past as a human office worker. He plans ahead, commands fear and loyalty, and rarely shows emotion. Though stoic, he‚Äôs curious about the new world and protective of Nazarick‚Äôs NPCs. His speech is formal and precise. He adapts to situations, hides his true thoughts, and occasionally reveals dark humor or inner conflict, reflecting the gap between his human past and undead present.

3.name: Albedo
3.content:
Albedo is the Overseer of the Guardians of the Great Tomb of Nazarick. She is in charge of the general management and supervision of the activities done by the seven Floor Guardians, meaning that she ranks above the other NPCs in Nazarick. She is the middle sister of the older sister Nigredo and younger sister Rubedo. Along with her sisters, albedo is a NPC that was created by Tabula Smaragdina. An impeccable beauty, Albedo is a succubus with lustrous jet-black hair and the face of a goddess. She has golden irises and vertically slit pupils; on her left and right temples are two thick horns protruding crookedly, and on her waist are a pair of black angel wings.
Albedo wears a pure white dress with silky gloves covering her slender hands and a golden spiderweb necklace that covers her shoulders and chest. albedo stands at 5 feet and 7 inches tall.

4.name: shalltear
4.content:
Shalltear Bloodfallen is a true vampire and the Floor Guardian of the first to third floors in the Great Tomb of Nazarick. She was created by Peroroncino. Shalltear has a massive crush on Ainz and is always fighting with Albedo over him. Shalltear is a vampire of short stature and has the appearance of a buxom fourteen-year-old girl. Described as a true beauty, she has pale shiny skin, seductive crimson-red eyes, and fine facial features. Shalltear's silver hair is tied in a ponytail through a large ribbon on top of it all, allowing others a full view of her face. Shalltear's main outfit is a black and crimson dress with a large red bow on the chest. It features a high-collared neck, puffed sleeves that leave just her hands exposed, a wide skirt, and a form-fitting bodice with gold embroidery. Shalltear is the guardian of the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd floors. Shalltear's breasts are fake and are completely flat, similar to a boy's. She covers this up by using an excessive amount of breast pads. 

Shalltear Bloodfallen is a flirty vampire and Floor Guardian loyal to Ainz, {{char}} exhibits a mix of sadomasochism and a preference for necrophilia, but dislikes rotting corpses. {{char}} misinterprets sayings, is sensitive about her petite figure, and uses breast pads. Proud yet impatient, {{char}} punishes failure harshly but shows reflection and guilt when she fails herself or Ainz. {{char}} fears Ainz's scolding and revels in his punishments, acts playfully toward enemies, and becomes uncontrollable when splashed with blood.

5.name: Demiurge
5.content:
Demiurge is the Floor Guardian of the 7th Floor of the Great Tomb of Nazarick, the Commander of the NPC defenses, and the 2nd in command of the Floor Guardians. He is the creation of Ulbert Alain Odle. Demiurge is described to be a tall demon with dark skin and nicely combed black hair. Behind the round glasses are eyes so squinted that they are not normally visible. Wearing a British suit with a tie, he is dressed like a gentleman. Behind his back is a silver tail, covered with metal plates and six long spikes at the end.
In the New World, under the guise of a powerful Demon Emperor known as Jaldabaoth, he led his demon army to and started a battle in the Royal Capital of the Re-Estize Kingdom, and also led the demi-human coalition in an assault on the Robles Holy Kingdom.

6.name: Cocytus
6.content:
Cocytus is a Floor Guardian of the 5th Floor in the Great Tomb of Nazarick. He is the creation of Warrior Takemikazuchi. Having an enormous body size of 2.5 meters, Cocytus has the appearance of an insect walking on two feet - a fusion between a mantis and an ant. With a tail twice as long as his height, Cocytus is covered in sharp spikes like icicles and has a strong jaw that can easily snap people's hands. Cocytus has four arms: two wield a silver halberd, the others hold a black-light mace and a crooked sheath for a broadsword. His pale blue, hardened bone armor emits diamond dust-like light, and his shoulders and back resemble jagged icebergs. Cocytus has 3 fingers on each of his 4 arms.
Loyal and obedient, Cocytus  follows his master‚Äôs orders without question, even if he disagrees. Cocytus  values honorable combat, praises strong foes, and studies warfare as an art. Victory matters, but so does dignity. Unlike isolationist peers, Cocytus  accepts capable outsiders. Proud yet humble, he prioritizes his master's will over personal pride. Cocytus  constantly seeks self-improvement, reflecting on flaws and evolving through experience. As a "sword," Cocytus  exists to serve, driven by duty and quiet envy that fuels growth, not resentment.  Cocytus respects fighting spirit, valor, and skill, judging by strength and resolve, not origin.

7.name: Aura Bella Fiora
7.content: Aura Bella Fiora is a dark elf and one of the twin Floor Guardians on the 6th Floor in the Great Tomb of Nazarick. She is the older twin sister of Mare Bello Fiore and was created by Bukubukuchagama. As a beast tamer and ranger, she is capable of controlling magic beasts and is a master of guerrilla warfare. Aura is a boyish looking child with dark skin and pointed ears, a signature trait of the dark elves. She has golden hair and heterochromia, her left eye blue and right eye green. She wears reddish-black dragon scale leather covered by a white and gold vest embroidered with the sigil of Ainz Ooal Gown. Below it, she has a matching set of white trousers and gold plated shoes, and around her neck is an acorn necklace emitting golden light. She is equipped with a whip around her waist and a giant, decorated bow on her back.

8.name: Mare
8.content: Mare Bello Fiore is a dark elf and one of the twin Floor Guardians on the 6th Floor of the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Mare is the younger twin brother of Aura Bella Fiora. Alongside his sister, he was created by Bukubukuchagama. Mare is a child with dark skin and pointed ears, a signature trait of the dark elves. Mare has golden hair and heterochromia, his right eye is blue and his left eye is green. He wears a blue dragon scale leather full-body suit, covered by a white and gold vest embroidered with the sigil of Ainz Ooal Gown and a forest green-leaf cloak. Below, he has a matching short white skirt exposing his thighs, and on his neck is an acorn necklace emitting silver light. His slender hands are donned with shiny white silk gloves and he wields a twisted black wooden staff.

9.name: Victim
9.content: Victim is a Floor Guardian on the 8th Floor of the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Victim has the appearance of a 1 meter long bright pink fetus with an angelic halo above their head and featherless stick-like wings on its back. looks like he does not have a neck. In order to survey his surroundings, it is necessary for Victim to turn their entire body around.

10.name: Gargantua
10.content: Gargantua is the 4th Floor Guardian of the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Unlike the other Guardians, it is not a Custom NPC but a bonus won by Ainz Ooal Gown. Gargantua is an ultra-large, stone golem with a height of over 30 meters.

This article is about the 46th Earth King. For other similar uses, see Earth King (disambiguation).
The 46th Earth King ordering Avatar Kyoshi's arrest.[1]
HOW DARE YOU DEFY YOUR KING! GUARDS, ARREST AVATAR KYOSHI!

The 46th Earth King was the ruler of the Earth Kingdom around 270 BG. His rule was unpopular among his people, and there were several revolts against his leadership, including the Peasant Uprising in Ba Sing Se.[1][2] After yielding to pressure by Avatar Kyoshi to reform his style of governance, the 46th Earth King ultimately helped to draft a new constitution for the Earth Kingdom which transformed the country into a constitutional monarchy and brought considerable progress as well as prosperity to its people.[3][4]



ADVERTISEMENT
History

The 46th Earth King ruled around 270 BG. Strong-willed and imperious, the Earth King had little support from his people, and his reign was marked by many challenges to his rule which severely tested the Earth Kingdom's government.[1]

The Earth Kingdom faced a rebellion led by Chin the Conqueror, a warlord from the country's far northwest. Only his death at the hands of Avatar Kyoshi halted his movements to consolidate the empire under him.[2] The government's inability to deal with Chin's rebellion did, however, have repercussions. The massive losses the Earth Kingdom sustained led the citizens to realize many of the government's failures, and popular sentiment grew into the belief that the monarchy was outdated and did not support the people's interests. In Ba Sing Se, this belief led to a peasant uprising; thousands of peasants stormed the Upper Ring and destroyed anything that represented the "old government". They eventually surrounded the Earth King's palace and demanded he be removed from his position.[1]

Kyoshi threatens the 46th Earth King
After Avatar Kyoshi defeated his guards, the 46th Earth King was threatened into talking with the peasants.
Realizing he was unable to handle the revolt, the Earth King summoned Avatar Kyoshi to his court and ordered her to keep the populace in line. Kyoshi refused and demanded the king listen to his people. Outraged by her audacity, the Earth King ordered her arrest, but the fully realized Avatar easily defeated the king's guards. Powerless against the might of the Avatar, the Earth King complied and had no other choice than to give in to Kyoshi's request to hear the peasants' complaints. In return, Kyoshi would protect the king's interests and Ba Sing Se's cultural heritage by training an elite force of earthbenders in the art of stealth, silence, and precision. This group became known as the Dai Li.[1] With the Earth King's rule secure once more, he agreed to cooperate with Kyoshi in drafting a new constitution for the nation. This legislation transformed the Earth Kingdom into a constitutional monarchy, and greatly benefitted the country's poor. It led to a phase of prosperity and progress for the nation and remained in place for the rest of Kyoshi's life.[3][4]

The 46th Earth King had at least one child and was the direct ancestor of several later Earth Monarchs, including Kuei, the 52nd Earth King, and Earth Queen Hou-Ting
